E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the abscess is small, then place the cautery according to the amount of the abscess, and then leave it for three days and place a stick covered in hide over it until what the fire has burned is subdued.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with gargles and poultices and bandages until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the cannula or cautery is like this.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter XXIII.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of cauterization of a sore throat and constriction of the ale.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When the humors come upon the throat of the lung, and mostly when that is of coldness of constitution, then the patient should be evacuated at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cauterize that, the root of the goiter in the depressed place.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And guard yourself that you do not reach the cautery to the goiter nor burn the skin of it except a little.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize that with another cautery, at the junction of the neck at the last vertebra of it.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	And the cautery of it be like the previous manner.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with the water that is preceded until it is healed.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter XXIV.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	Of cauterization of lung disease and cough.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and lung disease are of cold humors and the patient has no fever nor phlegm and it is an old disease, then cauterize it with two cauteries on the breastbone in the depressed places of the left and right; and with another cautery in the middle place of the foot between two toes; and be the cautery like the previous shape.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, be your cauterization pointed with the cautery that is called a point, the shape of which you preceded in the cauterization of ear pain.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And make points within those; and then cure it with the water that is preceded until it is healed.
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	And now let the cautery have three ramps because cauterization is done with this: in one time you can make three cauteries according to this form:
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter XXV.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	Of cauterization of the tic that is the head of the helper.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the helper is dislocated due to lubricous humors and is not fixed in the hour of its return to its place, and through a small movement it is dislocated again as it should, as we have testified, then cover that first you reduce the dislocation, and then the patient be reversed onto his back or onto his side; and then elevate the skin which is in the front part of the neck to the upper parts with the fingers of your left hand, if the joint is dislocated to the front part.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then ignite the cautery having two heads; and this is the shape of it:
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	And then cauterize the groin while it penetrates into the other side; and the figure of cauterization will then be that of four cauteries.
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And so this is subtle according to the quantity of tension; and this is the form of it:
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	And sometimes it is adjusted according to this count and because there are eight cauteries.
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	And then place on the cautery a piece of salt, and then make the patient adhere to the  flat surface, and the limb not be harmed for any time until it is comforted.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	And if the dislocation is in the upper parts and it is done thus, then cauterize over the muscle with a pointed cautery or with a burning cautery, for the joint is confirmed and the humidity is removed and the patient is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter .xxvi.
De cauterizacio del stomac.	Of cauterization of the stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When there comes in the stomach fire and many humidities, so that this extraction of its complexion and so multiplies in it, and if you continue the ways of cure and do not confirm it, then it is that the patient is on his two sides, and extends his hands and his legs, and then cauterize it with three cauteries: one cautery, leaving the foot for the quantity of a finger with a pointed cautery, and with two cauteries, leaving the two sides of the cautery, until the triangular figure of cauterization comes; and elongate between those that are not adjusted that they will make a puncture.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cautery is the quantity of two-thirds of the thickness of the groin.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And let the figure of the cautery be according to this form, and if you will, cauterize with a large cautery in the middle location of the stomach according to this form; and this be a cautery according to the form of a circle according to this form:
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	And let the stomach be cauterized pointedly to that one who is frightened by this cautery: and it is that you feel on the stomach point according to the quantity that you want with tension, and then cauterize it with a cautery in the points; and then cure it with the cure that is preceded until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter .xxvii.
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	Of cauterization of the liver fire.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When there comes in the liver pain by heat or by humidity or by excessive windiness so that its normal complexion is thrown by superfluous egress, and it is cured the patient with that which we have said and do not confirm it, then it is that the patient is laid on his back on his neck, and feel with tension three cauteries according to this form and this quantity placed on the liver below the hypochondria, the honor by the decubitus of man.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And let the space which is between each cautery be according to the thickness of the finger, and let the cautery be according to the length of the straight body.
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And do not compress your with the cautery much.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	And if the quantity of that which is adhered is the quantity of the majority of the width of the groin, and there is no more adjusted; and if the patient is standing on his feet; and if he is not standing, then he is lying, the one who has already extended his legs, and elevate his arms.
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cautery:
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And it is possible for you to cauterize these cauteries with a pointed cautery, when it is with your subtlety and prudence in the art.
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	And guard yourself that you do not process too much in the cauterization, and let the width of the whole groin be adhered so that it is adhered to the whole body and reaches into the intestines, for the groin here is subtle; and know this.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter .xxviii.
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	Of perforation of an abscess of the liver with a cautery.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When there comes an abscess in the liver and you want to know if that abscess is in the flesh of the liver or in its tunic, then if it is in the flesh of the liver, the patient feels a heaviness and pain increases.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is in the tunic of the liver, with the pain is increased greatly and sometimes that even exhausts the physicians the cure of it.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	Therefore, cove that the patient is laid on his back; and then feel the location of the abscess with tension; and then ignite the cautery which is assembled to rag, the form of which preceded on the other page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	And cauterize with that cautery until the whole groin is burned, until it reaches the hip, until it is healed.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with the cure of the other abscesses until it is healed.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And do not cove that of this form of cautery use only that of which the study in the art of medicine is prolonged, and in the most of which many diseases have been known; but with experiment some times it is dared upon this operation, but however, let that leave us, and it is better.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter .xxix.
De cauterizacio de plauresi.	Of cauterization of pleurisy.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	They said the ancients cauteries of the roots of aristolochia to pleurisy heat according to this manner to be done, and it is this that you take of the roots of aristolochia long dry a root pointed long that is found, and let it be of the thickness of the finger.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	And then submerge that in oil and place it in the fire, and then cauterize with a cautery in that location which is between the continuation of the clavicle and the neck; and with two small cauteries, I have guided, one slightly sloping towards the side that is below the beard, and with two cauteries in that which is sloping between the fifth rib and the shoulder blade, sloping slightly towards the rear; and another cautery in the middle location of the foot; and another on the stomach, and three cauteries from the rear; and one cautery in that location which is between the two shoulder blades, and two cauteries of the two sides of the foot, besides the cautery which is between the two shoulder blades.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And no cover that which you understand your hand with the cautery, unless it is in the manifest of the code in work.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And already said some ancients that some of men who use cautery of iron resembling a ray and ignite that, and put that in that location which is between the ribs, until they reach that and that abscess and be healed, so as we have said in the abscess of the thigh.
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	But in this perforation with cautery there is no fear, because he immediately accedes in the location fistula to which there is no healing.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter .xxx.
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	Of the cauterization of the spleen.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When you cure the disease of the spleen with what we have said of the cure in the division and do not confer your cure, then cauterize in it is according to three manners, all of which are straightforward, of which one is that you make three cauteries or four lines according to the length of the spleen according to the figure of the cauteries of the thigh, the figure of which has preceded.
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	And be between each cautery the thickness of a finger or a little more, and the manner of the cautery be the manner which we have said in the cautery of the thigh equally.
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	And do not cover your hand with the cautery; and the patient be elevated on his two.
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	And there is another manner of cauterizing, so it is that you ignite the cautery having two verticles, the cause of which we have said in the chapter of dislocation of the muscle, and elevate the code which is in the straight of the spleen the honor to reach the lying of the left patient.
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	And be the elevation with which you elevate the code according to the length of the body, so that cauteries be made according to the latitude of the body.
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	And then, between the two verticles, ignite the mot, in that into which you penetrate the code from the other part.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	And then you extract the cautery; and therefore four cauteries are made.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	And if you want, cauterize with a cautery having three verticles.
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	And then you cure the cautery because it had laid off for too many days, because it is more conferable than the other causes preceding in the cure.

De cauterizacio de ydropici.	Of cauterization of hydropsy.
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	Cauterize not cats in hydropsy but in alcinte3 properly.
Quan tu curas le ydropic am las manieyras de curacio las quals havem ditas en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que aquel cauterizes am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic e am un cauteri sobre l’estomac, e am autre cauteri sobre le fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa, e am dos cauteris entre les spondils del dos, e un cauteri en lo dreyt del pietz, e am autre cauteri sobre l’estomac.	When you cure the hydropsy with the manners of cure which we have said in the division and do not confer your cure, then cover that cauterize with four cauteries in the circuit of the umbilicus and one cautery on the stomach, and another cautery on the thigh, and another cautery on the spleen, and two cauteries between the vertebrae of the back, and one cautery in the right of the foot, and another cautery on the stomach.
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	And the quantity of the depth of the cautery be proportionate to the spicitude of the code.
E aprop layssa le cauteri ubert per so que gete brac per lonc temps.	And then lay the cautery open so that it gets laid off for a long time.
E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	And do not evacuate the patient from cure after the cautery with that which cover so that two understandings be added to it, and it be festinated to it with auxiliary healing.
La forma del cauteri am lo qual es cauterizat lo ventre sia clavilh segon que la forma de aquel es desus precedent, e es aquel am le qual es cauterizat le dos sia olivar segon qu’es precedent a la sua forma.	The shape of the cautery with which the belly is cauterized be a key according to the shape of which is precedent, and it is that with which the back is cauterized an olive according to which is precedent to its shape.

De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas.	Of cauterization of feet and of the thighs.
Quan les pes so apostematz en ydropitz e so repletz de aygua sitrina, cove que cauterisas les pes sobre le dos del pe in nocrati aquo que es entre le auricular e le anular, e eleva la tua ma am le cauteri e no torses aquel; e aprop eleva la tua ma, e no retornes aquela de tot, quar l’aygua satrina rezuda.	When the feet are apostematized in hydropsy and are filled with watery pus, cover that you cauterize the feet on the back of the foot in nocrati that which is between the auricular and the annular, and elevate your hand with the cautery and do not twist that; and then elevate your hand, and do not return that of all, because the watery pus recedes.
Es le cauteri segon aquesta forma: E aprop fay sobre las doas coyssas dos cauteris, e en quascuna coysa sia feyt cauteri am la extremitat del cauteri cutellar.	It is the cautery according to this form: And then make on the two thighs two cauteries, and in each thigh be made cautery with the extremity of the cautery cutellar.
E sia le cauteri segon la longitut de la coyssa: i dejos le denolh e l’autre jos le mieg loc de la coyssa; e sobre quascuna coyssa dos cauteris.	And be the cautery according to the length of the thigh; and one below and the other below the middle location of the thigh; and on each thigh two cauteries.
E layssa la plagua uberta ses curacio per lonc temps per so que alcuna aygua resuda de lu.	And leave the plague open ses cure for a long time so that any water recedes from it.
E aprop cura le am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas.	And then take care of those causes that we have said.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter .xxxiii.
De cauterizacio de cos de ventre.	Of cauterization of the belly.
Quan cos de ventre es per freg e per humiditat entro que debelice las vertutz, so es la vertut digestiva e retentiva, las quals so en l’estomac e en les budels, e es curat aquo am las manieyras de curacio e no confereys, e vezes le malaute suffertan cauteri de vertut exhiberant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am gran cauteri sobre le sieu stomac segon que a precedit en la cauterizacio del estomac, am le cauteri del cercle e am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic subtils, am cauteri clavilh subtil; e am cauteri sobre le alcatin sobre alozis gran, o am dos cauteris.	When the belly is caused by cold and humidity within that weakens the vertebrae, so is the digestive and retentive virtue, which are in the stomach and intestines, and it is cured by these ways of healing and not by confections, and sometimes the patient suffers cauterization to exhibit virtue, then cauterize with a large cautery on their stomach according to what has preceded in the cauterization of the stomach, with the cautery of the circle and with four cauteries in the circuit of the navel subtle, with a subtle cautery, and with cauteries on the skin above the navel large, or with two cauteries.
E si vezes las humiditatz exhuberants e le malaute aquo tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le pentenilh e sobre les budels, e fort leu ajustant dos cauteris sobre l’estomac e prop dels inguonas, quar es curacio perficent de juvament de la qual no erras.	And if sometimes the humors are exuberant and the patient tolerates this, then cauterize with them on the intestines and on the belly, and firmly adjust two cauteries on the stomach and near the inguinal region, for this is a perfect cure of healing from which you will not err.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter .xxxiv.
De cauterizacio de emorroydas antiquas.	Of cauterization of old hemorrhoids.
Quan so en la natura derier emorroydas antiquas o una de humors grossas fregas o de humiditatz corrompudas, e son curadas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no confereys la tieua curacio, lahoras cauterisa am tres cauteris sobre le pus dejos spondilh del dos petit e petit triangular, e am cauteri desus le ombelic cays per dos ditz.	When they are in nature, old hemorrhoids or one of thick humors, cold or corrupted humors, and they are cured by what we have said in the division and not by confections, then cauterize with three cauteries on the pus left spongy of the small and small triangular spine, and with cautery below the navel, in two digits.
E si doptas que l’estomac de lu sia enfregidat e la vianda de lu no sia degerida, e la cara de lu vezes apostemada, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre l’estomac am gran cauteri segon que es precedit; e am un cauteri sobre fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa de lu am cauteri clavilh, e leyssa le cauteri per alcun temps ubert, e aprop cura lu entro que sia sanat.	And if you suppose that the stomach of him be cold and the food of him not digested, and the face of him sometimes pale, then cauterize with a large cautery on the stomach according to what has preceded; and with one cautery on the liver, and with another cautery on the spleen with a subtle cautery, and leave the cautery for some time open, and then take care of him while he is healing.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter .xxxv.
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	Of cauterization of a boil near the abscess of them.
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When you abscess a boil, then you ignite the cautery that is assembled to a ray.
Aprop entremet aquel ignit en aquel atheyl abscis, e ultima la tieua ma entro que pervengua le cauteri al orifici de la vena de la qual ve la sanc.	And then introduce that ignited one into that abscess boil, and last your hand until the cautery reaches the opening of the vein from which the blood comes.
E fay aquo una vetz o doas, quar si achieyl son trops, lahoras cauteriza quascun de lor segon que havem recontat, e aprop cura aquels am aquo que confereys a lor dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And do this once or twice, for if the boils are too many, then cauterize each of them according to what we have recounted, and then take care of them with what confections you give them of the ointments until they are healed.
E si cauterizas am gran cauteri sobre alquatin, es mays derier en juvament.	And if you cauterize with a large cautery on the skin, it is more effective for healing.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter .xxxvi.
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	Of cauterization of fistulas that are made in nature in the parts of him.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When nature does not obey the work that we have recommended in its place, and the patient is frightened by it, be healed with cautery.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	Therefore, when one has a fistula in nature, and it is old, corrupted by pus and corrupted humors, and therefore that which is most worthy of being covered is that you probe it with a subtle tentacle, and then you know the quantity of the depth of it with the aforementioned tentacle.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	And then ignite the cautery that is similar to a ray.
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	And then introduce that ignited cautery into this fistula, and according to the quantity in which you introduce the tentacle.
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And iterate over that cautery within until those corrupted parts are burned once or twice or three times, according to the quantity of your necessity.
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant.	And guard yourself from burning of nerves and of veins; or if the fistula goes to the body of the bladder or to the body of the intestine, then guard yourself from all those places; and do not do this unless the fistula is in a fleshy place and you think that it is not penetrating.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	And then take care of the place until it is healed.
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	And if the place is sealed, and the materials are abscessed from it, and remain so for a long time, then you know that it is healed entirely.
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	And if the materials are not from it, then you know that it is penetrating or in the preon of it, or corrupted, or comes from those causes of which remembrance will come in its place.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter .xxxvii.
De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	Of cauterization of the boils.
Quan en les ronhos endeve dolor per freg o per grossa ventozitat, e per aysso le coyt del malaute es amermat, lahoras cove que cauterizes aquel sobre les ronhos am cauteri sobre quascun ronho am cauteri clavilh del qual precesic la rememoracio.	When in the boils, there is pain due to cold or thick windiness, and therefore the patient's body is inflamed, then you should cauterize those on the boils with a cautery on each boil with a subtle cautery of which I will recount the remembrance.
E fort leu cauterizam am le segon un petit dejos, per que vindran tres cauteris liniatz, e donc siran mays deriers en juvament.	And firmly cauterize them with the second one a little, so that three cauteries will come lined, and therefore they are more effective for healing.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter .xxxviii.
De cauterizacio de la vesica.	Of cauterization of the bladder.
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	When there is weakness and softening in the bladder due to cold and humidity so that the patient does not retain urine, then cauterize that in the part below the bladder, the one that begins the hairs of the navel, and cauterize with one cautery on the right side, and with another on the left side of him.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la cantitat dels not del pous; e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en la partida pus bassa del dos, o am dos cauteris si es necessitat.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the quantity of the knots of the foot; and cauterize that with a cautery in the lowest part of the back, or with two cauteries if necessary.
E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	And the cautery should be held according to the process.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter .xxxix.
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	Of cauterization of the womb.
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When moisture and humidity come into the womb, and because of this, pregnancy is prohibited, and the menstrual flow of the woman is corrupted, and the provocation of it is delayed, and pain occurs in the lower abdomen, then the place should be cauterized with three cauteries in the circuit of the navel, as we have said in the cautery of the bladder; and with a cautery on the place below the back, or with two cauteries, and the cautery should be held firmly.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter .xl.
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	Of cauterization of the dislocation of the hip.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When mucous humidities are poured into the part of the hip, and they are caused by the swelling of their place, and the sign of it is that the thigh is elongated over the other when they are compared between them.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the place of the dislocation is felt in that which is soft.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Therefore, you should cauterize the patient on the part of the hip with a cautery in a circle shape, as you will have sensed with your finger in the circuit of the part as it is turned, and so that the part falls in the middle of the circle.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And the cautery of which preceded the form in the cauterization of the stomach.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	And if this cautery is not present to you, then cauterize that with three cauteries with a large olive cautery.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And make the cautery according to the quantity of the thickness of the whole bone; and take care of that so that it be healed.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter .xli.
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	Of cauterization of the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain comes in the part of the hip, and it is caused by cold and humidity, the patient is cured with what we have said and do not confer, and that is ancient, then when you cut the patient of thick humors with fetid pills or with artificial pills or similar; and then cauterize that.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	And the manner of the cautery in that is according to two manners: the cautery with burning medicines, or the cautery with fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	It is according to two scientific manners, of which one is that you cauterize that on the part of the hip of him with three triangular cauteries according to this form; and make with those a good depth.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And be the spaces the which is between each cautery the quantity of the thickness of the finger and if the olive cautery or large.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	Sometimes, however, the cautery is on the middle part above the head of the hip, so that there are four cauteries.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	And if you want, cauterize with the circle of which the form is preceded in the cauterization of the dislocation of the hip, that is to say, a circle containing and burning the thickness of the whole bone.
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	And this is the manner of cauterizing in sciatica when pain is adherent to the hip and does not extend into the thigh.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	But if it extends into the thigh, then cauterize that with two cauteries on the thigh on the place to which you turn the patient that is the pain; and with one cautery on the cavity for four fingers a little below the fleshy part.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if the cautery is a knife-like one, and the depth of the cautery according to the quantity of the thickness of the bone.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if the patient reports that the pain extends to the place near the toes, then cauterize that here where you turn with a cautery for three points or four or more if it seems necessary to you.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if the patient reports pain being below the hip and the thigh, then cauterize that here with a knife-like cautery.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	And guard yourself in all cauterizations that you do not end with the cautery as much as you burn nerves or large arteries, and that because of that to you is over the patient evil or contraction.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And I have already seen one and another of those who cauterized on the cavity and ended in the cauterization, and the foot inflated with fire until the tumor reached the foot, and fire perforated and corrupted the whole foot.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And therefore, a strong solution of the belly, and that is death.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is in two parts at once, cauterize each one according to this manner.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	And the wise ones said in the cauterization of the hip, the cautery of which this is the manner: make a circle of iron, of which the circuit is the majority of a palm; and be the depth of it according to the thickness of a finger bone or a little less.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And from the inside of that circle, make another third; and be the spaces which is between them the quantity of the knot of the foot; and be those circles open on two parts; and be the length of those cauls a knot or two knots, and make in those marks of iron decently arranged in the circles; and this is the form of it:
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Then it should be ignited in the fire until it becomes red and throws sparks, and then it should be placed on the patient's back, the patient lying on their side.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And therefore cauterize that with three red-hot cauteries at once.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then leave that for three days; then plaster that with a poultice and leave the wound open for too many days; and then care for that with ointments until it is healed.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Says Albucasis: O, sons, of this kind of cautery we have used little because of the terror of looking at it, and because we have found few who guard over it.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	May the cautery on those who suffer it, and find it there.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	But cauterize with medicated ointments is that you make two circles having a perforated arm in which they put the staff of the iron gate; let the length of the sides in the breadth of them be two walnuts or what those are.
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And if the space which is between each one is the quantity of the thickness of the finger; and be open below and above, and be that they contain themselves between each other according to this form:
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	And then place on the patient's back, the patient lying on their side, and compress your hand on the area of the back; and then take some boiling water and pour it between the two circles, and the quality of that be with the small fire little by little, and keep that for the quantity of an hour, and suffer the patient the biting and the burning of it — for that biting is as if of fire — until the biting ceases.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	And then elevate your hand with the instrument and wipe away the boiling water from the whole back with cool water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	And then leave that for three days and place on that poultice until the blackness of the burning is removed, and leave that for some days, and it will run from it pus; this is later in healing.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then care for that with ointments until it is healed.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	And if the pain is extended into the thigh or the leg, make for it a statue in it that contains water as it is done in the back equally.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	And this is the manner of boiling water, and you have already written that in the treatise of the rectification of medicines.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Take alkali and quicklime, and mix them in equal parts, and grind them and place them in a new pot of which the bottom part is perforated by a small hole, according to the quantity that enters there.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	And place below the bottom of the pot another pot inverted, and pour over that alkali and quicklime boiling water, which covers them for a finger's width, and as you compress them with your hand for good compression, and leave the pot that descends from it water sharply in the bottom of the inverted pot.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	And then adjust all that water, and pour it over other quicklime and other renewed alkali, for that which is the case is of strong sharpness, which is administered in many operations of medicine and in cauterization of the other members, for that operation makes of fire.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And so of medicines some with which is cauterized much, as tezizic and honey anacrat and quicklime with sabao in such a way that they are mixed.
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	And Gualia recounts of an ancient man the operation and cure with which the pain of the back and sciatica is cured, and magnifies it very well to be of that, and says that there is no need for other cure, and that it is healed in one go as he recounts, for very strong was that intrec in bath and he sees already from that.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	And it is that it should be taken of green celery, and if it is not found green, it should be taken recent fig; and much be ground with a little of gray and be placed on the back in which is the pain, or in the thigh, or in the leg, and be tied.
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	And let it be left for the quantity of three hours or for the quantity that the patient feels cessation of the burning.
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	And then put that in a bath and therefore when the body of it is red, introduce that in the sun, for the pain ceases and it is healed.
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	And know that no one should use cauterization with these medicines except for the evacuation of the body.
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	But already Escorides says that when with a goat's wound the sciatica vein is cauterized, it profits him very well; and let the cautery be with it in this manner: take wool and soak it in old oil, and place it between the toes of the foot and between the heels.
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	And then take dry goat's gut and char it with fire until it is made into charcoal; and place it on the wool and leave it until it is extended.
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	And then repeat that, and do not cease to do that until the feeling of the biting reaches the back and repauses the pain.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	And this manner of cauterization is called cauterization of the goat.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter .xlii.
De cauterizacio de dolor de dos.	Of cauterization of pain of the two.
Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquelas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida.	Sometimes pain is in the two by many causes, as by accident or by percussion or by superfluous evacuation, and by causes to those similar, by infusion of cold and humid matter.
E cauteri no catz sino en aquesta sola specia la qual es fayta per efusio de materia frega.	And cauterize only this kind of lesion which is made by effusion of cold matter.
Donc cove, aprop evacuacio del malaute am pillulas fitidas e am semblant a lor, que sian faytas sobre·l dos en le qual es la dolor tres linhas segon la latitut de lu, pus que senhas am tentha en quascuna linha v cauteris o mays, segon la quantitat que ve de la tolleransa del malaute e de la vertut de lu.	Therefore, after evacuation of the patient with pills and similar ones, which are made on the two sides where the pain is, three lines according to the width of the area, because you should apply cauteries or more, according to the quantity that comes from the tolerance of the patient and the virtue of it.
E sia fayta cauterizacio am cauteri de punt.	And make cauterization with a pointed cautery.
E si vols, cauteriza am tres cauteris o am quatre am cauteri clavilh medial segon aquesta forma:	And if you want, cauterize with three cauteries or four with a medial chisel-shaped cautery according to this form:
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter .xliii.
De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	Of cauterization at the beginning of yellowing.
Motas veguadas endeve aquesta malautia als petitz enfantz; e senhal del comensament de lu en les enfantz es que accideys sobre lor estrectura en le ale eves la elevacio e·l movement.	Many times this disease happens to young children; and the sign of its beginning in children is that they stumble over their structure in the leg and feel elevation and movement.
E atrobas en le derier espondil del dos e dels notz de lu que ja comensa a sobremontar sobre les autres spondils.	And it protrudes in the last vertebra of the lower back and its joints that already begin to rise above the other vertebrae.
E donc quan tu vezes aquo e voles prohibir, lahoras cauterisa aquel am cauteri que sia cercle segon aquesta forma:	And therefore when you see this and want to prevent it, then cauterize that with a cautery that is circular according to this form:
que prengua le cauteri sobre tota partida del spondilh engualment.	which presses the cautery over the entire part of the vertebra evenly.
E si vols, cauteriza en le circuit del spondilh am le cauteri de punt dos linhas o tres.	And if you want, cauterize in the circuit of the vertebra with the pointed cautery two or three lines.
E sian les puntz propdas entre lor.	And let the points be close together.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat am aquo que havem dit.	And after cure the area until it is healed with what we have said.
Mays guarda que cauteri no sia administrat en gelbositat que sia fayta per spasme de nervi.	But beware that cauterization is not administered in yellowing that is made by a spasm of the nerve.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter .xliv.
De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	Of cauterization of gout and joint pain.
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E donc cum es curada podagra de causa frega am manieyra de cura e no so remaugudas las dolors, lahoras las remau cauteri.	And therefore, as gout caused by cold is cured by the method of cure and not only the pains are removed, then the pains are removed by cauterization.
E es que tu cauterizas aquel aprop evacuacio en le circuit de la junctura del pe am motz cauteris.	And it is that you cauterize that after evacuation in the circuit of the joint of the foot with many cauteries.
E sia cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let it be an olive-shaped cautery of which this is the form of it:
E si es necessitat que puntz sia fayt sobre la fassia del pe, lahoras fay am cauteri de punt.	And if it is necessary to make points on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery.
E si las dolors pujan entro als denolhs o a las autras juncturas, e aquo motas vetz s’endeve, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre quascun donolh am tres cauteris o quatre de tota partida am aquest cauteri olivar.	And if the pains rise into the toes or to the other joints, and this many times happens, then cauterize that on each toe with three or four cauteries of the whole part with this olive-shaped cautery.
E si motz cauteris que aquestz cauteris sian a tu necessaris, lahoras cauteriza aquel e no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri abans, sia tant solament enviro la specitut de la codena.	And if many cauteries that these cauteries are necessary to you, then cauterize that and do not press too much your hand with the cautery before, it is only around the shape of the bone.
E si las dolors pugan entro al donolh e·l dos, lahoras aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le sieu capitol.	And if the pains rise into the toe of the foot, then administer the cautery which we have said in its chapter.
E si las dolors so en las mas tant solament, e es apelada suagra, lahoras puncta en le circuit dels focils ayssi cum se revolvo, puncta en aquels dos linhas.	And if the pains are in the heel only, and it is called suagra, then puncture in the circuit of the heels as they are revolved, puncture in those two lines.
E si reman de las dolors en les ditz, lahoras puncta en le cercuit dels focils sobre quascun notz e sobre la pinche de la ma.	And if the pains remain in the fingers, then puncture in the circuit of the heels on each joint and on the knuckle of the hand.
E si las dolors pugan aprop alscus jorns als coydes o als muscles, lahoras cauteriza les quascus de tota part dels ajutoris.	And if the pains rise near certain joints in the elbows or to the muscles, then cauterize those of the whole part of the helpers.
E no evacuas le malaute de bon regiment e de recepcio de medicinas, quar si es fayt bon regiment e flacma es evacuada am aquest cauteri sira sanat, Dieus ajudan.	And do not evacuate the patient of good regimen and reception of medicines, because if it is done good regimen and it is evacuated with this cautery if it is healed, God help.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter .xlv.
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	Of cauterization of ruptures.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When it happens rupture in the groin and saying the intestines in front of the hernia, and this is beginning to happen, then, as you command the patient to leave his food on his day and that he uses of gentle causes so that the wound descends from his belly.
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	And after follow the patient between your hands over his back, and command him to keep his leg straight until it is thrown or the hernia or the intestines appear.
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	And after return that with your fingers and feel with your hand the rupture on the bone of the pubic bone with a sign the extremity of which is similar to the majority of a circle in the upper parts of the body.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And after ignite the cautery of which this is the form of it:
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	until it is very hot and throws sparks.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	And then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area so that the intestine does not come out.
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	You have already opened the space between the patient's thighs, placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands.
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	And after pause the cautery on that sign with your hand with cautery straight, and take that until with it you can feel the bones of the pubic bone into the middle of the groin; and repeat with that other time if to you that one has not achieved in the first time into the bone.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	And observe carefully the position of the intestine during the time of your cauterization, so that you do not burn that intestine so that upon the patient there comes no death or other great evil.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	And know that when you have the cautery do not touch the bone, do not confer your operation.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	And cover that the cautery of children be subtle according to the size and measure of them.
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	And after care the place of the cautery for three days with border until the scab of fire is healed.
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And after care that with other ointments until it is healed.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	And the patient shall lie upon their back for forty days until the place and the plague are sealed.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And cover that you pause the nourishment of him according to the length of time of the cure of him the which linesca the belly of him, and that the intestine does not come out because of the effort of healing.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And after when it is wanted to raise him after forty days, then administer him decent food, and keep that for another forty days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And be wary of work and repletion of food and drink, and of much voice, for when he uses this regimen of healing entirely he will be healed.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And you say the cure of ruptures in other parts of the belly, and so at the beginning, and you want them not to be pulled, then cauterize the rupture of that with a round cautery according to the quantity of it, and be that which is exhumed from the codena as such as the third part of it; and after care that with that which we have said, and it is not adjusted.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And already some first say that rupture be cauterized with a triangular cautery according to this form, because it is marked with a tenta:
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	And it is placed a line which goes by the latitude in the latz which is most superior of the rupture, and another line below; and pause your hand with a cautery clavilh, but the first cautery is lighter and better.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter .xlvi.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	Of cauterization of torsion.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When it happens in some members by accident or by percussion pain and that pain persists for a long time and does not confer to the cure with medicines, then cover that you cauterize with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And be the cautery of every member according to the magnitude and smallness of it, and virtue and weakness of it, and location of torsion and pain of it.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	Therefore if it is healed by the first cautery, well is; and if not, then iterate upon it the cautery; for of custom of those pains it is that they be pointed of member to that member which approaches to it, for that cover that you cauterize those within that the patient is healed.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter .xlvii.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	Of cauterization of leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Leprosy some times with cautery by great help, and more so if the species of leprosy that is made by putrefaction of phlegm and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And therefore as you want to cauterize that, consider if the leprosy is common and has that cured with that which we have said in the division and do not say, nor is it, and fear upon the patient that the corruption comprehends the whole body of him and the whole complexion of him, then cauterize that upon the head with 5 cauteries: with one in the middle location of the head, and with the second further below it, and ves the front to the end of the hairs; and both upon two horns; and with one behind, upon the nape of the neck or service.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And lastly your hand with the cautery a little while until it impresses upon the bone a small impression, and from it the scabs are displaced, so that the expiration of gross vapors is alleviated from it; and cauterize upon the flesh according to that which is necessary.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	And if the leprosy is already expanded upon the patient and appears manifestly, then cover that you cauterize that with those cauteries which we have said in the head; and with a cautery upon the extremity of the nose, and with two cauteries upon the two cheekbones, and with two cauteries upon two vertebrae of the neck, and with six cauteries upon the vertebrae of the back, and one great one upon the vertebrae near the hip, and one upon the rib, and with two upon the ankles, and one upon each ankle, and with two upon the knees, and one upon each knee, and with two upon the elbows, and with two upon the muscles, and with two upon the tendons of their feet; and cauterize that upon all the joints of the fingers of the hands and of the feet, and upon each heel of their feet, and upon the hollows of their hands.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And guard yourself of the nerves which are upon the talus that you do not burn those.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And sometimes it is cauterized with a cautery upon the bone of the penile and with another upon the mouth of the stomach, and another upon the liver.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And know that when you adjust more cauteries, so much is more helpful and more conferent; and know that the patient has no pain in the cautery, as such as they have, for so that the body of him already is stupefied.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And cover that the cauteries be great or few according to the members and the joints according to that which is preceded of the species of the instruments.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then carefully apply the cautery with flour of herbs mixed with honey and the other cure within which it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter .xlviii.
De cauterizacio de stupor.	Of cauterization of stupor.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When some limb is numbed or asleep and is treated with medicines, oils, and plasters, and is not healed, then you cauterize that numbed limb with cauteries according to what merits the size of the limb or its smallness.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And let your cautery enter the  depth of the flesh a little.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that with an enema until it is healed.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	And sometimes it is cauterized, some stupor which extends to the arms and feet, and to the vertebrae of the spine, and the emergence of the nerves which move that limb, and the stupor is removed.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	Do not presume about this, but only he who is wise in the anatomy of the limbs and the egress of the nerves of the whole body moving.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter .xlix.
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	Of cauterization of ulcers that are mortified.
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When an ulcer is old and does not respond to any of the medicinal enemas, then you cauterize over it with a cautery, a little, according to the quantity of the depth of the flesh, until it is removed, the whiteness and color of it, and the color of it is changed.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that with flour of herbs and lentils mixed with olive oil and leaves of arnica, and the blood of a dove or the blood of a round, from each one a part and all are mixed, and then apply a cloth and place it on the spot until it is healed.
Capitol .l.	Chapter .l.
De cauterizacio de cranc.	Of cauterization of crabs.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When cancer begins and you want to stop it, then cauterize it with a circular cautery around its circumference as it is turned.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	And some wise people say that it should be cauterized with the back cautery in the middle place; but to me, this is not seen, because I fear that it will be ulcerated, and I have already seen this some times.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	And it is more right that it be cauterized in its circuit with a circle as we have said, or with moving cauteries.
Capitol .li.	Chapter .li.
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	Of cauterization of  abscesses.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When some abscess is delayed in maturation, and so it is because of the superfluity of that which makes it, or because of the state of the patient, who is old or decrepit, of little blood, or because of time, and you want to hasten the maturation of the abscess; then cauterize it in its circuit with small, moving cauteries; and then let it go so that it will hasten in maturation.
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	But if you want the perforation of it with a cautery, then you ignite the cautery of which this is the form: and place that in the middle place of the abscess until it penetrates the flesh.
E si le cauteri en aquel loc que es pus dejos, per so que le cors del brac sia alleujat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the cautery in that place that is furthest, so that the body of the arm be relieved; and then treat that until it is healed.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter .lii.
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	Of cauterization of corrodents.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	Corrodent is a corruption that walks in the limb, which corrodes it as fire consumes dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore, if you see that corrodent in a place that suffers cauterization with fire, then you ignite small, moving cauteries, and large ones according to what is convenient in that place where the corrodent is.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And then cauterize that from every part until you eradicate all the corrosion and no cause of it remains.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	And then let it go for three days, and place on the cauterized places a cloth soaked in oil mixed until all the scars are eradicated and all the corruption.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	And then treat that with enemas that generate flesh.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	But if after three days you see that healthy flesh is born in which there is no corruption, well; but if not, then repeat the cautery on what is raw in the corrupted places.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And corrodent is medicated some times with sharp medicine, which that is placed in the place of cautery.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	But however, cauterization with fire is of more light help.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have already said the cure of it with sharp medicine in the division, and therefore take that when from you will have need.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter .liii.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	Of cauterization of warts and other similar things.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Many times there is a disease in the lower parts of the foot that is called a wart, and it is a large, fleshy cause, which deforms the foot; and cauterize those in two ways, so it is cauterization with fire and cauterization with boiling water.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	But cauterization with fire is that you ignite the cautery concave in the shape of a vulture's beak, which is made of iron according to the quantity which contains the wart from every part, and be of subtle margins.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	And then place that ignited on the wart, and then revolve your hand with the cautery in the circuit of the wart until the cautery reaches the depth of the wart.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And let him rest for three days before he begins to wear a bracer.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	And apply a poultice made with wild mallows crushed with salt to it, and leave the poultice on it for one night, so that it is eradicated from its roots.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And cure the area with a wash of generative flesh until it is healed.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it is not converted, and many times this happens on the surface of the body, mostly in the hands and feet, then you should administer cautery with water to those.
