And take a small nozzle of lead or iron or vulture's bone, and place it over the boil; and pour into the nozzle a small quantity of water, and hold your hand, and you turn it with compression of your hand, and press the edge of the nozzle into the root of the boil, and it will draw the water a little way into the depth of the root; and wait for the patient a little the biting of the water for an hour, and then remove it, because the boil with its roots will be eradicated.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And thus do with those, and the other until you come upon all of those on the body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And cure those pus that the roots of the boils are eradicated with this wash that the flesh generates.
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter .liiii.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	Of cauterization of tremor.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When someone has a tremor due to a fire in the nerve or from a feverish cause, or from another similar cause, then you should cauterize that with four cauteries or five on the vertebrae of the back, between each vertebra with a cautery; and with cauteries on the feet of him, and on his stomach, with olive cautery.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the tremor of him is rested and hastened the health of the feverish disease.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter .lv.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	Of cauterization of white accidents on the body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When on the body are spread white spots, and they are pustules split which are made of coarse corrupted matter; therefore at the beginning when it appears, that it be cauterized over all head of the fistula with a subtle cautery with twigs of myrtle, the extremity of which is extended with fire; or with roots of erestologia long; or with a lentecular cautery.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	And sometimes it is cauterized additionally at the beginning of its expulsion in this manner; and they are not believed, and the superfluity is broken, doing those, and heals from those.
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	But nevertheless, it must be done after evacuation with phlebotomy.
Capitol lvi.	Chapter lvi.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	Of cauterization of flux of blood accident by incision of artery.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Often times there is a flux of artery that is incised, the plague which must be for sure, or the incision of abscesses or cauteries of the limb, and then similar, and it is difficult to remove that.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore, when this happens to someone, then you must cover with your hand the orifice of the artery, and place upon it your finger, pressing it strongly many times until the flux of blood is stopped by your finger, and that it does not come out.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And apply on the fire the olive cauteries few and large, by number a few, and exhale over those while they are a little ignited.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And take of those one small or one large according to the place and the plague in which the artery is broken, over that vein swiftly pushing that you have removed your finger, and place the cautery until it is abcised and restricted that blood.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood is expelled from the orifice of the artery when you remove your finger and extract the cautery, then take another cautery well heated from the cauteries which in the fire are prepared, and therefore do not cease to do this one after another until the blood is restricted.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And guard yourself that you do not burn the nerve that is here, and that it comes upon the patient another malice.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And know that when from the artery flows blood, then it is not possible in those to restrict the blood, and especially when the artery is large, if not by one of four ways: or by cautery as we have said, or by extraction when it is not extracted, because when it is extracted the extremities of him are much burned and the blood is restricted, or that it be tied with a thread or with a ligament for strong structure, or that medicines be placed upon it of which the virtue is to restrict the blood; and be tightened with a cushion with decent constriction.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	But he who administers decent restriction to him with a ligament and with constriction with cloths or by position of burning causes and similar things, do not confer otherwise than sparingly.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if this happens to someone and the physician is not present nor medicine, then open with the placement of the finger indicated upon the orifice of that vein as we have said, and understand the great constriction of him until the blood is stopped from the sovereign part of the plague, and upon the artery the finger is not removed; and over the artery be sprinkled with cold water of much great coldness until the blood is coagulated and thickened; and more sew in that which has to cauterize or of medicine necessity.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begins the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incisions and perforations and ventoses and of phlebotomy and of poultices and of their likenesses.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucazis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter all the illnesses in which the use of a cautery with fire is convenient and with medicine that is burning, and the occasions and causes of it, and the instruments necessary for it with the forms of the cauteries; and I have ordered the chapters of the governance of the head down to the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And I will proceed in this chapter in that same manner, so that the reader may be instructed on what he has asked.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And first of all, know that in this chapter what is said is in terror of what is in the first chapter of cauterization.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And for that, know that great caution must be exercised in this chapter, for in the operation which is in this chapter, many times, a catz evacuation occurs, which is with blood, with which the life of the person is at stake, the sprinkling of the vein or incision on the abscess or opening of the fistula or purification of the wound, or the extraction of the arrow or incision of the stone and their likenesses.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And of all those, fear and trembling accompany, and in the midst of them, death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I admonish you that you should not fall into that which is stated, for sometimes the case of illnesses requires that you handle men with many illnesses.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And of them, some will go away with their illness and it is lighter for them to die, and thus because of the vehemence of what they find of their illness, and because of the length of their illness, and with the illness is fear, which means death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And of those is the one who gives to you his hope and says, "you await with that health," and his illness is pernicious.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore, know that you should not consent to that one who comes to you of whom this manner is; and your caution should be greater than covetousness and your greed; and do not presume any cause on that, but only with certain knowledge which verifies that, and to which, through a praiseworthy succession, you will be rewarded.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use in the cure of all your illnesses, prognostication and indication of them, to which health is converted, for in that, you are helped in the acquisition of fame and memory, of praise and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	Oh, children, may God breathe his understanding into you and guide you in your direction and protection, for that is in his hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have ordered this chapter, distinguishing it into chapters, as it preceded in the chapter of cauteries, from the care of the head down to the feet, so that what you have asked for and of which you have need may be alleviated.
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the cure of the water which is contained in the head of children.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Know that this illness often happens to children during childbirth and when the midwife tightens the head of the child, it is harmful.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And sometimes it happens for a hidden cause which is not known.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	But I have not seen this illness except in children; and to all those whom I have seen, death came, and thus it is that I have seen the laying down of work in them.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen a child whose head was filled with water, and his head was always so magnified that he could not sit on himself because of the size of his head, and more than that, the humidity increased so that he died of fire.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this humidity is either added between the bone and the bone, or it is added outside the bone on the skull.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	For the operation in that case, if the humidity is between the bone and the bone and the abscess is small, then you should make in the middle of the head with a fissure in the latitude, and the length of the fissure be two nights, so that the humidity runs, and this is the form of the spatula:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And therefore, if the humidity is more increased and the abscess is larger, then there are two fissures according to this manner:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the humidity is outside the bone, the sign of it is that you see the sutures of the head open from all sides and the water is squeezed when you compress that with your hand on the sides of it and it is not hidden from you.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	Know that you should make in the middle of the head with three fissures according to this manner:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And then, extract all the humidity with the incision; and then tighten the fissures with cloths and cotton; and then apply that above with wine and oil until the fifth day, and then untie the bandage and cure the wound with tents and ointments, and tighten the head with equality; and feed the patient with dry food of little humidity until the member is comforted and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And there is another manner of incision, which you should consider, honoring the magnitude of the abscess and the collection of water, for sometimes it is more in the occiput, or in the front part, or on the right, or on the left; and therefore, attend to the incision where the abscess appears and the repletion of the water, and do it according to what is best for you.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And observe that you do not incise the artery and it does not flow with blood and the patient dies from that flow of blood with the evacuation of humidity.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter II.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Of the incision of the arteries which are near the ears, called hilasseysse.
Capitol segon.	Chapter Second.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When a catarrh or wound occurs in the foot or toes, and it becomes chronic, and no relief is found in this cure through medicines, then the following cure is incision of those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And therefore, when you want to incise those arteries, the patient raises their head, and you press the area with a rough cloth so that the arteries appear, and then tighten the patient's neck with some cloth; and consider where the vein is; and the places of each on the places that are near the ears are depressed, and they are so hidden unless in some men.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then, you press on the artery with a tent, and you incise each one with the sharp edge of the spatula, making the incision go into the bone, and this is done for the width of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you wish, you insert the spatula below the artery and break it at the incisions on the upper parts.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And the length of the incision should be two fingers' width, because when any vein is incised, the blood is emitted with a pulsatile egress, which jumps out by frequent jumps.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery does not appear to the touch, then you must measure from the ear the quantity of space of three fingers, and then press with a tent, and go into the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And this is the quantity of blood that must be extracted is the quantity of one ounce. And do not take more or less than this, and all this is according to the quantity that appears of the virtue of the patient and the repletion of the artery of him.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And consider the plague, and therefore if there remains on the bone any cause of the plague, then incise this so that it does not become a purulent abscess.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then strengthen the wound with cotton and bandages of cloth, and cure that with ointments until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	Of the extraction of the arteries which are in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When a certain ancient migraine or acute catarrh occurs, due to humidity of the air and the quality in the temples, or a very violent and similar ancient ailment, and it is medicated with the ways of medical cures and this does not bring relief, then we have resorted in these ailments to the extraction of the arteries in the temples, or cauterization of those as we have shown.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the manner of the operation and extraction of those is that the patient raises their hair where it is in the temples; and understand the artery appears in the temple because it is shown by its pulse, and it is hidden unless in few men by the vehemence of the humors.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden from you, then the patient's neck is tightened with some cloth; and then press the area with a rough cloth or evaporate the area with warm water until the artery appears manifestly.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then you take the spatula of which this is the shape:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then you cut the tendon with that with ease until you reach the artery; and then you put it on and extract that to the upper parts until you extract that from the tendon and uncover that of the tunics which are below that, entirely.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is subtle, then you wrap that with the extremity of the onion, and then you incise that one part according to the quantity by which the extremities of it are elongated and contracted, and there will not be a flow of blood, because if it is not incised it will not raise the blood of all.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And then evacuate the blood of one ounce. within three.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the artery is large, then you must tie that in two places with a double strong cord or with long ropes, and do not let it putrefy before the consolidation of the wound and it will become a flow of blood.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And then incise the superfluity which is between two ligaments; and do this at that hour or another hour.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you wish, cauterize that with a cauterizer into the bone with a cauterizer cutter until the extremities of it are incised, and stay in place of that messy work.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	And it is a better work if the patient has a fever or is of a hot complexion; because cauterization is of those causes that help the final humors, and therefore it is better in judgment.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And after the extraction of the arteries, you should apply the area of the incision with a poultice decently made, and then be cured with dry medicines that make the flesh rise and with ointments until it is healed.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if while you are working another vein becomes a flow of blood from the artery, then you must take care to constrict that blood, or with cauterization, or that you apply the area of the incision, and tighten your hand until the blood is restrained.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if for any of those causes it is not present to you, then pause your finger on the area until the blood is coagulated, and apply the area with water of very great coldness until the sharpness is rested, and tighten it according to what is necessary.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And that which is lightest in the extraction of artery is that you cauterize the vein with this cautery having two handles, because you have marked the two places with a probe, and after a pause, a little bit, until they reach the bone and cut the vein in two places, so that it be elongated that which is between the extremities of him, because they are not consolidated at all with this cautery.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the shape of the cautery:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And the sharpness of the two handles is at the same time.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	But however if it is less sharpness that two handles is better, because if it is sharp with two handles it approaches to each burn, and does not cut the flesh with velocity.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore, as in those there is some thickness, the heat of the fire is held in those and the flesh is slightly cut.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this work is better in all work and lighter.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And the spaces which are between two handles the quantity of the thickness of the finger.
Capitol quart.	Chapter Fourth.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	Of the cure of the bodies of acute and sour humors of the heels.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When the humors are sour, and the bodies of those veins which are on the surface of the head of the foot, and do not comfort in that any cause of the cure of medicine, and sometimes the face of the patient already reddens and feels in his forehead a walking as if it were walking of ants, and the heels of that are exhausted, humid so much that already the hairs of theirs are known, and the eyelids are scalded by the sharpness of the tears, the ancients mixed sour things in the cure of those of this operation, and numbered that cure with space.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And it is that you command the patient to shave the hairs which are on his forehead, and then cut three fissures equally distant according to the length of the forehead.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the fissure is two fingers: one fissure be equally distant to the length of the nose in the middle place of the forehead, and the second according to the length a little of the movement of the lachrymals which are in the lacrimal, and the third on the other part.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And guard yourself of the incision of the arteries which are in two places, and elongate your hand from the continuation of both mandibles.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space of each incision the quantity of three fingers adjusted.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if to you a piece of sponge dressed or cloths dried a little with which you dry the blood.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And then insert the spatula of two sharp extremities, of which this is the shape of the incision of him:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	which is from the partition of the temples into the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Excoriate with that all the flesh which is between the two incisions with the ciphrac which is on the bone, and then make that of the middle incision into the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And then straz in this spatula and insert into the first incision another time an instrument which is called a cutellar, sharp on one part and on the other not sharp.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And pause the side of that sharp deves the flesh annexed deves the flesh, and the side of it lean into the bone, and push that until it reaches the middle fissure, and cut with that all the vessels that descend from the head to the heels.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	But that the incision be continued to that which appears of the flesh, and then make that in the middle fissure into the other fissure.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And because it runs of the blood quantity equal, express the places of the pieces of the congealed blood.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then pause in each fissure calf of old cloth, and pause over those powders put in wine and oil and wine vinegar, and vegas that it do not become a caut abscess.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day unties the bandage and administers great infusion of  cauda water or tebeza, and then cure that with an enguent bazilicon with rose oil and others until the wounds are healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter V.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	Of the cure of lagremas by catartz and in the heels descending from the parts behind the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When it happens that some come with catartz acute and continuing, and sometimes the heels of the patient exhausted little, and already the regard of them is debilitated, and the eyelids ulcerated and of their case the hairs, and in the crown of the head is acute pain leading and exhaustion consequent, then you know by these accidents that the matters and catartz do not come but of few veins of the parts behind coming.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best cure in those is this: that you command the patient to shave his forehead, and then cut into that one fissure in the middle place of the forehead, a little by the latitude (and begins with the fissure of the left temple into the right temple; and be incision into the bone; and elongate your hand of the lachrymals of the temples which are maught deves the mastication), until it be the bone discovered.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Exsicca all the blood with sponge or with dry cloth and then repleys between the two lips of the fissure with old cloth or with rags of linen.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then strengthen above with powders put in wine and oil so that it do not become a caut abscess.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you untie this and see that the abscess has already diminished, then cover the bone within which the flesh begins to grow, and then take care with that drying regimen that makes the flesh grow, thus as if you take two parts of wheat flour and four parts of colophony and mix it, and of it make a poultice and administer it in these sores at the birth of the flesh.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	Of the cure of that which catches in the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	Every cause that catches in the ears is one of four species, or it is mineral stone or a similar cause like iron and lead, or it is of plant such as onion or bean, or it is a fluid cause such as water and sour wine and their likenesses, or some beast.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And therefore when stone catches in the ear or another cause similar to those causes that do not fit or grow in the ear, and place the ear in the sun, and if you see the stone, then distill in it some cause of violet oil or sesame, and then administer the extract of it, and make the patient snort with a condition, and plug the nostrils to prevent the event of snorting.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then place in the circuit of the ear some pieces of cloth or wool, and extend the ear to the upper parts, because many times it is thrown out with these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not thrown out, then administer the extract of it with the instrument called the gesti epicicarios subtle of which this is the form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is thrown out with the gesti, well is; and if not, then administer the extract of it with a subtle onci of little duplication.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And therefore if it is not thrown out by this, then make a canula of silver and introduce the extremity of the canula into the tract of the ear and close around the canula with wax and softened oil so that it is not open except the canula.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract with your wind with strong suction, because many times as with the water that we have recounted.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if it is not thrown out in this manner, then take of a lit halka or of a vecz apparellhat with which the birds are taken a little quantity, and place that in the extremity of the ray, and then envelop over that cotto decently placed.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then introduce that into the tract of the ear with facility, and then dry the ear of the humidity.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And therefore if it is not thrown out with all the causes which we have recounted, then you must resort to cutting that before it becomes an abscess or spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the manner of cutting that is that you at the beginning lances the patient of the cephalic vein and extracts the blood according to the manner of the virtue of it, and then make that cesser between your hands and convert the ear to the upper parts, and make with a small fissure in the root of the ear, over the grey of it in the place well pressed of it.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And let the fissure be of lunar figure until it reaches the stone, and, the stone being caught, remove that if you can with appropriate instruments; and then close the fissure in that hour with velocity, and take care of it until it is healed.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the catching cause in the ear is one of the greases that grow and swell, then administer the cure and the extract of it; but if it does not obey your treatment, then you take a subtle teune spatum according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	and administer with that the abscess of that grease which is caught in the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not do this when you think that it is already moistened by the vapor of the ear, and place that in many pieces, and prop extract it with the oncis or with a subtle gesti, or with an incision as we have said, because the extract of it is alleviated.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water which is introduced into the ear, cover that the patient uses of snorting with a condition at the beginning, and fill his ear with some old cotto, and pour over that ear in which is the water, and if by this it is thrown out, well is; and if not, then take many small pebbles and leons according to the length of the finger, and calve those in the fire a little, and the patient introduces one of those into the tract of his ear and jumps on one foot of that part and percusses with another pebble on the pebble which is inside the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Therefore do not cease this with pebble until all the water is thrown out.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And already the water is thrown out so that you take paper or of gonc, i., and put one extremity of it in the ear and extend the other extremity with fire until it is burned the most of it.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And then put another gonc and do this as many times until all the water is thrown out, and straz that with a canula as it is said from the stone extractor.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But in the extract of beast entering into that ear, if it is a small thing, as it is to it and similar, cure that as we have said in the division; but if it is of a large thing which causes appears at the end of the vessel, then administer the extract of it with gesti and oncis, and the cause of it is pus lighter of all the other causes that catch in the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But in the extraction of worms generated in the ear, when you treat that with what we have said in the division and in the treatise of distillations and do not compare your cure, then it is necessary that you watch the ear in the sun.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore if there is here any cause of the worms, then extract that with a tool or with subtle instruments, but if there appears no cause, then take a cannula that is narrow at the bottom and wide at the top, the form of which is this:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And introduce the subtle extremity into the ear according to the quantity which the patient can bear; and then suck with that by strong suction, and do this several times, until all the worms are expelled.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if you do not obey this, then you plug and close the circuit of the cannula with wax as we have said; then administer distillations which have already been prepared in the cure of worms, and you will find this in the treatise of distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And this is the effusion with which you pour the medicinal oils into the ear with this instrument of which this is the form:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make that of silver or of brass, narrow at the bottom, and with a small hole at the top, and flat at the bottom.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And therefore it is as if it were in the concavity of the cannula, here where it is necessary.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you wish, take the reed and wrap it at the end decently with cotton, and then pour oil into the concavity of the ear, or juice of some herb, or water that you want of these medicines into the cannula — and that is in the ear — and then introduce the reed with cotton on top and express with your hand that with moderate compression of it until the oil is expelled into the concavity of the ear and the patient feels the oil inside.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And that which is infused into the ear be already scalded with fire a little.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And guard yourself that the cause which you distill into the ear is not too cold, for the medicines of the ear do not tolerate that.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter .vii.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Of the cure of ear opacities.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Sometimes babies are born from their mothers' wombs unperforated, and this sometimes happens to some men, opacity in the meat of the ear due to plague or by flesh nothing in that; and this opacity sometimes is made in the preon of the ear canal which does not see the light, and sometimes is in the parts outside.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which happens in the preon of it, which does not comprehend the light, is in the greatest dispositions of difficult healing.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that one which you can see the light, then it is necessary that you place the ear of the patient in the sun and watch it.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore if you see opacity appearing, open that with a subtle spatula of which this is the form:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the extremity of it, in which the width is small, of which one part is sharp and the other not; and the spatula is of two latz leon so that it does not make a hole in the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And therefore if the opacity is by flesh born in the ear or in the meat of it, then take that with subtle instruments and cut that vehemently easily until it is stayed all the flesh.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the opacity is in the preon of the ear, then take a subtle reed and scald that with fire a little, and then put that in the meat of the ear.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And therefore if you have felt opacity with that which the patient feels easily, by gravity of hearing, exert the oppression of it easily; and guard yourself that you do not plague the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then place in the ear a cloth according to the quantity of the width of the canal which you have wrapped in the Egyptian ointment; and do this for some days until you are sure of the consolidation of the plague; or that you take some and put that in water and pulverize it over it, following the three times, and use it; and if you see the ear already being aposthemed, then it is necessary that you extract the one and replace it with another one which you wrap in cerot that is made with rose oil, until the pus is cauterized; and then cure it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if there happens a flux of blood, then immerse a sponge or cloth in cold water and place it on the ear, and use the other cure which you restrict the flux of blood, which is said in the treatise of distillations.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter .viii.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	Of the cure of the itch which happens to the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	The itch which happens to the eyelids of the eyes sometimes is humid, sometimes is dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore, it is necessary that you have those with tweezers or with instruments, and you cut those with a spatula from their roots, and then place over the spots three times a day.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if there is pain with a flux of blood, then you cauterize those with a subtle lancet cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is after the incisions and several times return when there remains some cause of their roots; and when they are cauterized with fire, those roots are burned and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Treatment of swelling that comes to the eyelids of the heels.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Often, a swelling appears in the eyelids of the heels, some cause which is assembled to a great hardness and rigidity, and by its greatness it is called.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an accumulation of thick moisture in the eyelid below and above.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, the operation on them is that you consider if the swelling is proceeding in them in that which appears from the eyelid and is bad to all parts; and the cause of it is lightness.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore, cut on that with a fissure along the width, and then drain that from all parts with ease while it evacuates, and then suspend that with a bandage and cut off that.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if to you it is not apparent the incision of it, if not that you penetrate the eyelid with incision little by little, then that you do not notice in any cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the figure is large, then you adjust it with sutures; and care for that while it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, to you it will not come to harm for that because the ointment of it restores that and encases it.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the swelling is declining to the parts of the inside of the eyelid, then you scrape the surface of the inside, then you open the eyelid and suspend the swelling with a bandage, another that you do not dig into incision, and press that from all parts, and if the eyelid by incision is lengthened, then that you do not notice in any cause.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And then to the incision, wash the heel with salt water; and care for the location with water that encases while it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	Of the cure to be done on the eyelid above the heel.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	The ailment is gray which is generated in the tunics of the eyelid above, and mostly happens to children, it aggravates the heels of those and accedes to their cataracts the most; and they cannot look at the brightness of the sun because of that because tears are collected to those.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And because of that, those times they make about their faces all the time, and on their faces they sleep; and on the eyelids of their below the eyebrows are humid, the ones that already have covered inflammation, and the imminence of encasing appears in the eye; and that when you press the location with your fingers, you feel encasing within those.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And some manner of operation is in that which the patient puts his head in your, and then you put cloth on him and make a poultice, and make of it a circle according to the quantity which contains arthernach from all parts, and then you put that on that and press with your fingers from all parts so that it may be aggregated arcernach in the middle of the circle, and then you cut in the middle of that humidity with a spatula incisive with a fissure along the width, and the fissure not be greater than the fissure that is made in a flap-cutting.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	But in the pressing cover that you make the incision whole until you reach arcernach, because in the most appropriate processes arcernach is processed by fissure according to the form of white gray.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Therefore, extract that with cloths the ones which you have enveloped between your fingers to the parts before and revolve between your right and left hand until it is dispersed.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And guard yourself that you do not adjust in the fissure so that with the spatula you do not reach the heel and you scratch that.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	But if it does not appear to you arthernach at the beginning of the fissure, but that you adjust in the fissure a little with ease until it processes arthernach; and then extract that as we have said; and then submerge cloths of it in water and wine and put them on the location and strengthen those with powders.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And so those that crush salt and put that in the concavity of the fissure so that that which is remaining of that humidity.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then care for that while it is healed.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	But if it happens in the location abscess caut, then care for that with poultices cedatils until it is healed.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	Of manners of touching the heel.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When in the eyelids of the heels the hairs are born from the adjusted below the natural hairs and they are antiquated, then those annoy the heel and make become manners of ailments as such as continuous tears and softening of eyelids and web until that is a cause of destruction of the heel that is called tactinir of the heel, and care is done in four manners: or by cautery with fire; or with acute medicine according to that which was said before in the chapter of cautery; or it is made tactinir by incision and suture; or by canes according to that I have said.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And therefore, cover that you put the head of the patient in your, then convert the eyelid of the eye with your left hand, and if it is converted, good is; and if not, introduce a needle into that in which it is faithful of the part below of the eyelid, and make penetrate the needle with faithful below, and that be - near the edge of the eyelid in which naysso the hairs - near the hairs, and pull the faithful to the parts below with the eyelid, and convert that with the ray.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	And then cut in the part inside of the eyelid below the hairs adjusted with a spatula incisive from the lacrimal major into the lacrimal minor; and then extract the faithful and put below the eyelid little powders of cotton or of cloth, and then send over the eyelid with tent, and be as such as the figure of a myrtle leaf.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	But however, the figure should be according to the quantity of elevation of the eyelid, for this is already diversified in men, for some of those who are indigenous that it should be incised of the eyelid a large quantity according to the quantity by which the eyelid is softened.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	Then bring the spatula over the two lines which you have made, and begin from the greater lacrimal into the lesser lacrimal.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if your fissure is near the natural hairs as is the thickness of the king.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	And then place the ounce in one of the two angles of the bone, and then scrape that whole thing, and then adjust with the incision the two lips with a thread or a fine wool thread, and wipe away the blood, and make adhere that which superfluous from the threads on the two eyebrows with some enviously causes, if you want to do this, and if not, don't care.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	And then remove the suture of the threads within three days or four, and then care for that.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	And if you want, leave the plaque with its suture, and care for that with something that dries and constricts, for the eyelid is raised, it deserves the sealing of the plaque and the adhesion of it; but suture is better, and therefore I say this as the ancients did taxanir.
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	But however, there should be solicitude over the patient, and it is a good operation, and there is no fear in it.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	And it is another manner in taxmir, and it is that you make on the eyelid a figure as a myrtle leaf, and then elevate the eyelid with three separate and congregated hooks according to this form:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	But if it is not possible, have the hooks, and that is not equal, then take a needle in which there is a thread and put that in the middle of the figure, and introduce the other thread near the greater lacrimal, and the other thread near the lesser lacrimal, and adjust between those two threads with equality, and then with those elevate your hand with equal elevation, elevate the whole bone on which it is marked as we have recounted.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust the two lips of the plaque with suture, and care for that until it is healed.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	But if an abscess occurs from your incision or your fissure, treat that abscess with cerot and similar things, and with unguents.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And some times it becomes necessary for the eyelid that its hairs be converted, then it is necessary to use in that of what we have said of incision; but suture in some is more artificial.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	To taxinir with canes is according to this form:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	And it is that you convert the eyelid and split the figure which is described according to what I have recounted; and then by art make two canes or two subtle splints of which the length be according to the length of the eyelid and the width of them be less than the width of the spatula.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already incised at the extremities of each of the parts, where you have the threads.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	Then add each one with subtlety above what superflueys of the eyelid of the heel, and constrict the canes of each of the parts with a strong stricture, and leave that for some days, for the bone by the stricture will die and become denied and will be able to enter until by itself it falls.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	But if it is late, then break it with the pliers, and then care for the plaque until it is healed.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	Therefore, as it is solidified, the eyelid is elevated and the hairs do not sting.
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is the form of two canes which you will make according to this form:
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	And have the quantity of the length and width neither more nor less.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter .xii.
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	Of elevation of stinging hairs in the heel with a needle when the hair is hard.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When the hairs are non-natural, hard and rough and stinging the heels, then the operation in them is that you take a subtle needle and place in it a subtle thread of cedar and linen, and then that you adjust the extremities of it and nuts in a very subtle manner.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And let the length of the threads be the quantity of one palm.
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	And then you compose another subtle thread below it in short, and use the extremities of that if you want.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	And then place the patient their head in your lap, and be near the sun so that your work be declared, for it is a subtle and delicate operation.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	And then introduce the needle into the root of the hair adjusted which has need of engineering, and make that penetrate into the eyelid carefully until you extract that from the natural hair.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	And then pull the hair down and introduce it into the alixati, and let the hairs be one or two or three and no more.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And then pull your hand with that until the hair be floated with alixolati in the eyelid with the natural hair.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if it is thrown alixalati and it is not floated the hair, you will throw alixati to the parts below with the thread which you have composed with that, until in it be floated alixalati of the trau sobira.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And vegas that with the vision of the heel, for then you will throw alixati and the thread, and grotan something and clautz the heel, and lay the claus for two days or three, until the hair adheres to its place and grows on that good flesh.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	And if the skin is too short, then you adjust a longer piece of skin from the natural hairs, and elevate it with that, or that you let it enter so that it is lengthened towards some space, and then you elevate that.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	Of the cure of the cataract which comes in the upper eyelid.
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When it comes in the pupil and is a contraction of the eyelid when it is contracted upwards, or on the right or left side, due to bad consolidation of a plague or a cautery, and it is called a leporina, and this cataract is either natural or accidental, and it is made by the consolidation of a plague or incisions or cautery, or by something similar to their malcuratz.
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	The manner of the operation in it is that you make that consolidation and that you separate the lips of it, and you place in it in that which is between those a piece of cloth, and tie those together until they are healed.
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And no cover that you use of cure of it of the causes which dry it, constrict; because if you do that it returns cataract worse than any time no foc had.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Use in that of causes that soften it as is fenugreek, and embroca with the water in which they are cooked altea and its seeds, or enguent dyaquilon, which be liquefied with some of the oils, and submergeys in that the cloth, and cure with that.
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	And the treasure of your cure is that you perforate with all engine that it is not consolidated according to the form that foc at the beginning.
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation which we have said, is not but any rectification of cataract that does not return the form of the place according to that foc before.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV.
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	Of the cure of cataract which is made in the lower eyelid.
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	This cataract which is made in the lower eyelid, which is truly called cataract; and it is of it some natural, other accidental.
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	More accidental is made by plague or by incision or cautery or by others similar.
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	And the way of the operation of it is that you take a needle in which make double thread, and fix that in the flesh, and that you make it pass from the lacrimal of left into the lacrimal right, until that the thread arrive in the two extremities of the flesh.
