Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is a small abscess, then take it with the forceps and excise it from the root.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then you suspend it with a hook, and excise it, and then you cover it; and adjust the poultice with suture, and care for it until it is healed.
Capitol .li.	Chapter .li.
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	Of the section of an abscess which happens from the cheek that happens to the belly.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	And it happens to some men, growths in the bellies of those and in other parts of the body of those, the ones that are called fungous due to a similarity to those with fungi, of which the root is subtle and the head of it is thick; and already the lips of those are turned, and it is of those that are small, and it is of those that are much magnified.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have already seen one, and in the belly of him there were two parts the ones that were more like fungi, and there was no difference between those white, of fine root.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And already the lips of those were reversed and they were splitting, and humidity ran from that all the time.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore, I incised those and attributed in the one in a weight of 18 ounces. and the other of 6 ounces.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the operation in the incision of them is that you consider it, if the patient is humid, and the color of the one is white, humid, of subtle root; then you excise it with a spatula wide, and be in your presence cauterize in the fire, because many times the blood of the section of it is expelled much; and if you see the blood, cauterize it.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if you see the patient fearful and timid, guard yourself from incision with iron; but then take a lead of recent lead made, and strengthen it with that one, the manner of which is that we have said; and leave it there for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	And then adjust in the constriction of the lead thread; therefore, do not cease strengthening the lead greatly until it is excised and falls by itself from its labor.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the one is of thick root, then in the incision of it there is some cause of fear and of terror, and more so in the one that is in the belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But possibly it is that you incise the majority of it, and then cauterize it so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And then care for it until the wound is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And guard yourself that you do not presume to incise the one that is of dusky color, of little feeling, of little regard, because that one is an abscess cancerous.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I will come with a remembrance of cancer nearby.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter .lii.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Of the cure of eminence of the navel.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	Eminence of the navel is made by many causes; or by fissures of the fascia which is on the belly, and there are of it the cloth or bowel according to what it should be in the other ruptures; or by blood which flows from a vein or artery according to what has been said, or by contracted wind in it.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is by fissure of the fascia and by the protrusion of the cloth, then the color of the abscess is similar to the color of the body; and it is lion its pain, and then it appears from diverse situations.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is by the egress of the bowel, then the situation of it with it of what we have recounted, of more vehement diversity, and when you press it with your fingers it is hidden, and then it returns; and very much is in it so, and it is magnified much of the introduction of bath and vehement labor.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is by humidity, then it is lion and is not hidden when you press with your hand, nor is it constricted, nor is it believed.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is by blood, then with these signs appears the abscess in black declining.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is by flesh nothing, then the abscess is serious, thick and hard, and it is placed according to a quantity.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is by wind, then the touch of it is lion.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation in it is that you consider it, if the eminence of the navel is by blood of artery, or of vein, or by wind; then you must be prohibited from the cure of it, because in that there is fear and terror as you have been taught in the chapter in which I have said the abscesses by artery and by vein.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the prominence of the navel is due to a hernia or a tumor, then command the patient to hold their leg and stand extended; then, gently probe around the entire navel, and command them to lie flat between their hands on their back, and then surround the area you have probed with a spatula, large; then extend the majority of the abscess to the upper parts with a large hook; and then tie around it with a strong thread or a cord and in the manner of tying decent.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And then pull the tip of the abscess extended over the ligament and introduce your finger into that point and try to feel the hernia; and if you have found it or held it by the ligament, then you extract it and push the hernia to the sides of the abdomen.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have found the tumor, then take it with a hook; and cut away the superfluities of it.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is contrary to your artery or vein, then surround that spot, and then return to your operation; and take two needles and put in those two strong threads and introduce the two needles into the circuit that you have made around the abscess in the manner of a cross, which you make penetrate; and then tighten the abscess in four parts over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you wish, remove the needles and leave the place until the stretched flesh can fall by itself; or cut that when it is subsided and can be done, and then cure that with water that comes from the roots until it is healed.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the prominence of the navel is of flesh nothing in it or by humidity, then command that you hollow out the abscess as we have said and extract the blood or humidity, which you find in it, and then cure that with water that comes and that consolidates the place.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter .liii.
De curacio de cranc.	Of the cure of cancer.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	As we have said, in the division, of the species of cancer and in what manner it is cured with medicines, and that it is dangerous in it the cure with iron so that it is not ulcerated; and we have said cancer generated in the marrow and the caution of its cure.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients said that sometimes cancer is in a place where it is possible the eradication of it, as of cancer that is in the nipples or in the groin and their likeness of the limbs allocated to extract all of that, and most when it is beginning small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is old and is large, you should not trust it, because I have not been able to heal from that ailment nor have I seen another, nor that has come to that.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation in it is when it is allocated as we have said, is that you precede and leave the patient and purge of black bile sometimes, and then bleed him, if a manifest repletion is found.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	And then prepare the patient with preparation in which he is placed with the operation, and prohibit in the tract hooks which command to that; and concave from all part with the good bone spatula excavation until no remains any cause of the roots of it.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And let the blood run, and do not cut that lightly, and express the places, and wipe away the thick blood all with your hand or with an instrument with which is to you possible of the instruments.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if to you makes contrariety of thick blood incision of vein or of artery, then cauterize that until the flux of the blood is ceased, and then cure that with the other cure until it is healed.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter .liv.
De curacio de ydropici.	Of the cure of hydropsy.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recounted, in the division, of the species of hydropsy of water, and the signs of each species, of the cure of it with medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And that which is cured with iron is only the species of althitas alone, and it is not approached with iron to the species of tympanistres nor to the species of yposarcha, because that is mortal.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have already medicated this species of tympanistres hydropsy with medicines and do not confer your medication, then consider, that if to the patient already is obtained debility, or is with that other ailment another hydropsy, as if it is in it cough or body of belly and similar to those, then guard yourself that you do not medicate him with iron, because fear is over that.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you see the patient of exuberant virtue, and in it there is no other ailment but hydropsy so alone, and not child nor old, then the manner of the operation of it is that you elevate the patient between your hands, and the minister then expresses the belly of it with his hand, expelling the water to the side below the navel, and then take a spatula spines according to this form:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	be of two parts sharp long, of acute extremity as a spatula; but however be in it some shortness little by little, so that in the operation with that you do not pass into the hernia, and that you lead that.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And then consider if the generation of hydropsy is of the part of the hernias, because then command that with the section you are to the navel for the quantity of three digits to the sides below, in the right of it above the navel.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the generation of hydropsy is by ailment of the liver, then your section be left of the navel for three digits.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if the generation of him is by the measles, then the section of him should be to the right.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And do not let the section be on the side on which the patient wants to move, so that the superfluities do not run to that place freely.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	And then pierce with the instrument the whole length, and introduce yourself into that section, and elevate your hand with the spatula between the length and the skin, and you will scrape that; and if the quantity of a fingernail or around.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And then pierce the skin until the spatula reaches the desired place, and it is the place of the water.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then extract that and introduce an instrument of which this is the shape:
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	and it is similar to a silver cannula; it is made of silver or lead or tin, to which at the lower part of it is a small hole, and on the sides of it there are three holes: two on one side and one on the other side; and the extremity of it is made blunt according to the manner of a feather, as sometimes:
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And at the sovereign extremity of it is an armlet, for when the instrument reaches the water, then that instantly rises above the instrument, therefore evacuates the water in the middle quantity, for if you evacuate more than that in the hour, then very soon the patient will die by the resolution of his animal spirit, or you will cause him five-pi that is approaching death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	But evacuate from that according to the quantity of the virtue of it and according to what they signify to you the dispositions of the patient from the virtue of his pulse and of the goodness of it.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	And then extract the instrument, and retain the water which causes it for as soon as it is retained by the length which retains the hole that is on the skin of it and recommits to you that you pierce it again in that manner.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	And then repeat the instrument on the other day if the patient tolerates it, and extract a small quantity of water, and do water for some days on fear, and guard yourself from error so that you do not remain of the water but little.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	But if you fear for the patient, and let out a large quantity of water, then cure him with burial in fine sand, and move his suzor in a bath, and in the sun wait for a long time; and cure him with drying medicines until he is healed.
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	And cauterize on the stomach, and the measles and the fitge approach the extraction of the water, according to what I have recounted in what precedes.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter .lx.
De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	Of the cure of children who are born with the places of the urine unpierced.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Sometimes some of the children are thus from the belly of their mother and the head of their mixture is not pierced (or it is a straight hole or it is not in its place).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Therefore, it is necessary to cut with perforation of it as soon as it is born with a very fine spatula according to this form:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	And then pause in the hole a fine lead nail and tie that, and keep it for three days or for .iiii.tre.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when he wants to urinate, he is urged and urinates; and then return that.
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you do not pause the lead, it is already possible that the urine which goes on the place, does not let this opening.
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	But that one of whom the hole is straight, be medicated with a lead nail, as we have said, for too many days until it is amplified.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga.	But those in whom the hole is not in its place, are leddies, which causes it for those, that one who is born and the hole is of the end of the head of the vagina because he cannot urinate at the sides of it, until he elevates the vagina with his hand to the upper parts; and it is not to his generation, for so the sperm cannot reach the mother according to rectitude, and it is a very bad disease.
E la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que·l malaute sia envessat sobre le sieu dos, e aprop exten le cap de la vergua de lu am la tua ma sinistra am vehement extraccio, e inscideys le cap del cap de la vergua del loc del perpucii am spatum agut, ayssi cum es inscizio de pluma, o que tu ne razas alcuna partida, per so que·l mieg de lu vengua semblant al cap de la vergua e que le trauc caia en le mieg loc segon que cove.	And the manner of the operation in him is that the patient be laid on his back, and then extend the head of the vagina of him with your left hand with vehement extraction, and inscise the head of the head of the vagina of the place of the perpucii with a sharp spatula, as it is inscized of a feather, or that you do not graze any part, so that the middle of him comes to resemble the head of the vagina and that the hole falls in the middle place as it should.
E guarda te que en la tua operacio de flux de sanc, quar motas vetz accideys aquo; e pausa te a lu am aquo que abscindeys le sanc, e cura la plagua entro que si’ sanada.	And guard yourself in your operation of blood flow, for many times accidents happen there; and pause yourself to it with the water that you abscindeys the blood, and cure the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lvi.	Chapter .lvi.
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	Of albater which happens in the prepuce on the head of the vagina and of corruption and blackness and adhesion of the prepuce of the head of the vagina.
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	Many times this albater happens in the vagina and is a prominence of bad flesh.
E de aquela una es maligna e autra es no-maligna.	And of that one is malignant and the other is not malignant.
No-maligna, cove que suspendas am unci subtil e abscindas aquela entro que aquela mondes tota; e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto submirgit en enguent egipciac; e aprop aquel, cura le am enguent diafinicon entro que sia sanat.	The non-malignant one, it is necessary that you suspend it with a fine unci and abscind it until that one mends completely; and then place on that, a cotto submerged in Egyptian enguent; and then that one, cure it with diafinicon enguent until it is healed.
E si albater es maligna, de lega color, lahoras cove que tu aministres cauteri aprop la inscizio de lu e la razio de lu.	And if the ulcer is malignant, of a dark color, then you must administer cautery near the edge of it and the root of it.
Mays si albater es en le prepuci del cap de la vergua no-circumcis, e la una partida de albater es dedintz le prepucii e l’autra partida es defora, lahoras cove que tu ostes albater le qual es dedintz al comensament entro que es consolidat; e lahora tu cura aquel deforo, quar quan tu curas aquel ensemps le prepuci, no es asegurat que no sia trinquat.	And if the ulcer is on the foreskin of the uncircumcised penis, and one part of the ulcer is inside the foreskin and the other part is outside, then you must remove the ulcer that is inside at the beginning before it is consolidated; and then you treat the one outside, because when you treat the one inside at the same time as the foreskin, it is not certain that it will not be torn.
E ja eysamen accideys en les genetius e en le prepuci negror e corruccio, adonc cove que tu conquavas tot aquo que ja es denigrat e que ja se vol corrompre o que ja es corrumput; e aprop lineys sobre aquel aprop aquo am mel, le qual es contusit am farina de scorsa de milgrana e de errs trissatz e crivellatz.	And if ulcers occur in the genitals and on the foreskin, blackening and corruption, then you must remove all that which is already blackened and which is about to corrupt or which is already corrupted; and apply a line over that with honey, which is mixed with ground rind of millet and crushed and sifted herbs.
E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	And treat that with the other cure until it is healed.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	And if there is a flow of blood, then administer lunar cautery according to this form:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	Because cauterizing is helpful for two conditions at once, so it is for bleeding and for the plague when it is corrupted.
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	And if the head of the penis is corroded and destroyed all at once, then you must introduce into the flesh of the foreskin a lead pipe so that the patient urinates through that.
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the adhesion of the foreskin to the head of the penis (and this adhesion does not occur except in those whose foreskin is sound, and on which circumcision is not performed; and when adhesion occurs due to plague or abscess) you must scrape with a blunt spatula until the ligament is dissolved and the head of the penis is released from all sides.
E si es dificil desirnir aquelas exquisidament, lahoras cove que tu excorjes am spatum alcuna causa del cap de la vergua e del prepucii, e aysso es quar le prepucii, quan es subtil, fort leu es perforat per la sua subtilitat leugierament.	And if it is difficult to separate them delicately, then you must scrape with a spatula some cause of the head of the penis and the foreskin, and thus it is because the foreskin, when it is thin, is easily perforated by its own thinness.
E aprop separa entre·l prepucii e·l cap de la vergua am dra7 de li subtil, le qual ja es mulhat en l’aygua frega per que no adherescan autra veguada.	And separate between the foreskin and the head of the penis with a thread of linen, which has already been softened in cold water so that they do not adhere again.
E aprop sia curat am vi stiptic entro que sia consolidat.	And then treat it with a styptic until it is consolidated.
Capitol .lvii.	Chapter .lvii.
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	Of the purification of children and the cure of those who suffer from circumcision.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a solution of continuity like other plagues: but because it is of our operation and our will, and it is proper to those of our children, it is necessary that we assign in that better operation and way lighter loss to health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore I say that the ancients did not write about circumcision in any of their books, because they did not use it in their laws, and it is only because we have acquired it through experience, the reason for which is that I have found the majority of artisans and barbers use circumcision and purification with a knife and with torches; and they use a ligature with a thread and an incision with the nail.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	And I have already tried all these methods and have not found better purification with shears, with a ligature with thread than with purification with the nail, because many times the chain escapes from below, because the foreskin has two tunics, and the tunic remains further down, and it is very easily forced to another incision and certain pain.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	And in purification which is done by alphecati, and is digital, of which the shoemakers use, the incision of the extremity of the male member is not secure, because it very easily enters into the furrow of it.
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	But in the operation with a nail, very easily it obtrudes iron and corrupts your operation.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the foreskin of the child is short by nature, and many times it stays in such a manner that there is no need for purification, and I have seen that.
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	But of the purification that is done with shears and ligatures with thread, the goodness, experience has shown me, because the shears are of proportional incision, for which the sharpness that is below is as the sharpness that is above; and therefore as you press your hand so proportionally to the two sharpnesses, and incise accordingly with a comparison in one time; and it is made compression of the thread with a figure containing the foreskin of the penis from all parts, with which there is no error of all.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	And the manner of the first operation is that you make the child lie down most if it is of those who understand a little, that you do nothing but tie the thread on his penis just as much, and that you leave it there until the next day.
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	And then make him happy in all that manner that is possible to you from what receives his understanding.
E aprop fa aquel estar entre las tuas mas estatuir preparadament, e no sia ges cezent; e occulta las forfexs en la tua ma o dejos le tieu pe, que l’enfant no veia aquelas ni degun autre dels instruments.	And then make him lie between your legs, prepared, and do not be seen; and hide the shears in your hand or at your feet, so that the child does not see them nor any other of the instruments.
E aprop entremet la tua ma a la vergua de lu e suffla en la codena, e tira aquela entro que sia eyssit le cap de la vergua, e aprop mondifica aquel de aquo que es agregat en ela de sordicia.	And then put your hand on his penis and puff on the foreskin, and pull it until the head of the penis is released, and then purify that which is attached to it of filth.
E aprop lia le loc signat am fiel dobla, e aprop ligua pus bas de aquel un petit le segon liament, e aprop te am le dit pous e endic tieu le loc del liament dejos am bona retencio, e inscideys entre dos liaments.	And then tie the place signed with a double thread, and then tie a little lower than that one, the second ligature, and then take hold of the place with your fingers and indicate to yourself the place of the ligature below with good retention, and incise between the two ligatures.
E aprop eleva la codena sus leugierament e estratz le cap de la vergua; e aprop leyssa le sanc corre petit e petit, quar es milhor ; e pausa polvera desus e sobre la polvera pausa drap en le qual es spandut mugol de huou coyt en ayguaros concosit am oli rozat recent bo; e layssa aquel sobre aquel entro al autra dia; e cura aquel am curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then gently raise the patient's hips and straighten the head of the bed; and then let the blood flow little by little, because it is better; and place powder on it and over the powder place a cloth in which is spread lard of a cow in water boiled with rose oil recent; and let that be on that until the next day; and care for that with care until it is healed.
La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	The shape of the forceps for modification, this is the shape:
Sian las unas extramitatz no-talhantz e las autras sian talhant, que non sia yssit le ram del clau, e sia la longitut de las doas acuitatz ayssi cum la longitut de dos manubres engualment.	Let one pair of limbs be non-cutting and the other cutting, so that the ram of the key does not come out, and the length of the two points is as the length of two arms equally.
Mays la error en mundificacio es quar fort leu efugeys la codena intrinseca tota, o partida de lu deves la inscizio.	But the error in modification is that if too much of the internal spine is removed, or a part of it is cut, the incision will be too deep.
Donc cove que tu extendas aquela de la tua hora am la tua ungla denant la apostemacio del loc e que inscidas aquela segon equalitat.	Therefore, as you extend that with your fingernail in front of the abscess and cut it according to equality.
E si no la podes tenir am la tua ungla, lahoras extratz aquela am unci e inscideys aquela.	And if you cannot hold it with your fingernail, then extract it with a tool and cut it.
Mays si son passatz tres dias, e roman aquo que es imflat dejos la vergua apostemat, lahoras tu leyssa aquo entro que sia cedat le apostema caut, e excorja aquel am fecilitat, e inscidex aquel segon que a tu es preparat.	But if three days have passed, and the abscess remains swollen, then let it drain until the abscess is softened, and scrape it with ease, and cut it according to what you have prepared.
E guarda te del cap de la vergua, quar no nosera a lu aquo.	And guard yourself from the head of the bed, because it would not be good for that.
E donc cura aquel am aquo que la plagua consolida de las polveras las quals havem recomtadas en le tractat de las polveras.	And therefore care for that with the poultice that the plague consolidates from the powders that we have recommended in the treatise of the powders.
E si es inscidit de la codena sobre mesura, e obezeys a las partidas desus, aquo no notz a lu.	And if it is cut from the spine beyond measure, and it sags on the parts above, it will not be good for that.
E mays cura aquel am aquo que havem dit entro que sia sanat.	And however, care for that with the poultice that we have said until it is healed.
Capitol .lviii.	Chapter .lviii.
De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	Of the cure of urine retained in the bladder.
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Retention of urine in the bladder is caused by an obstruction caused by a stone or blood clot, or by a tumor or a tumor-like growth, and similar to those of water that we have said of the ways of cure in the division.
E si no es dissolvuda la urina, e veses retencio de lu esser per peyra le qual ja es en le col de la vesica, lahoras cove que le malaute sia encorbat sobre les sieus denolhs.	And if the urine is not dissolved, and the retention of it is because of a stone which is already in the neck of the bladder, then the patient must be bent over his knees.
E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible.	And then place the patient's feet on his hips and extend his belly from the part above his hips, and the patient strains as much as is possible for him.
Donc lahoras le col de la vesica es costreyt ha espulsio de la peyra a las partidas detras, per que la urina es absolta.	Therefore, then the neck of the bladder is constricted to expel the stone to the rear parts, so that the urine is released.
E si no es dissolvuda am aquo que havem dit he vehement es fayta la causa sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que aministres extraccio de lu am instrument le qual es apelat siringua, del qual aquesta es la forma: Sia de argent e sia subtil leon conquau, ayssi cum canula de pena de ausel am subtilitat de ray lonc en similitut d’un palm e mig, al qual sia cana subtil en le cap de lu.	And if it is not dissolved with the water that we have said and the cause is very strong on the patient, then you must administer an extraction from him with an instrument called a syringe, of which this is the shape: It is made of silver and is a subtle cone, as well as a tube of bird's feather with the subtlety of a long ray in similarity to a palm and a half, to which there is a subtle tube at the head of it.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	And the way of administering the urine with this is that you take the flexible tube and tie it in the middle with wool or thread for good adhesion; and you insert the ends of the tube in the part below the syringe, and cut with the forceps if there is any excess of wool, but introduce it into the tube with force, and then insert the syringe with a border and with album of a cow.
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And make the patient lie on the bed, and massage his bladder and the bed with wet oil, olive oil, and water.
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	And then insert the syringe with ease until it reaches the bottom of the bladder; and then double the bed above the belly; and then push the syringe into that; and then push it until it reaches the bladder, and that the patient has reached the cause, and it is not done according to this order, but the meat in which it goes in a tortuous way.
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	And then extend the tube with the wool little by little, because the urine will soak the wool.
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	Then extract it and do for the cure of urine, and use the syringe, do not cease to do this and use the syringe until the bladder is evacuated and the patient recovers relief.
Capitol .lix.	Chapter .lix.
De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	Of the quality of clysterization of the bladder with clamps and similar instruments which are agreeable to this.
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When an ulceration or abscess occurs in the bladder, or a blood clot is found in it, or it is constricted by a tumor, and you want to distill waters and medicines into it, then it is done with an instrument called a clampcedra, and this is its shape:
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	But at the middle of it is a closed, so it is closed.
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And in it there are three tubes: two on one side, as well as the other.

Then introduce the extremity of the clamp into the vagina as we have recounted in the language; and then push the humidity with water, because that humidity reaches the bladder immediately, and the patient feels that.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	Shape of the subtle cristeri by which the bladder is cristerized, and that is the form:
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	And it is made of silver or lead, of which the cap is like a small feather, and below it a canal is threaded.

Capitol .lx.	Chapter .lx.
De extraccio de peyra.	Of the extraction of a stone.
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already said in the division the species of stone and their cure with medicines, and the difference between stone generated in the kidneys and stone generated in the bladder, and the signs of that.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have said the stone in which catz operation with hand, and section.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And the stone generated in the bladder properly is that which is lodged in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And you so narrating that with manifest exposition and abbreviation.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	Therefore, I say that stone generated in the bladder mostly comes to children; and of the signs of it is that the urine that is expelled from the bladder is similar to water in its subtlety, and appears in it as sand; and the patient feels his vagina, and many times it pains, and then it is raised; and with that water, it seems that the anus is full of those.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And it is easier the healing of children of those who have reached fourteen years; and it is difficult cure in the old.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	But in the young it is milder because it is among those.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And of that from which the stone is larger and the cure is easier; And if it is little, it is contrary to that.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Therefore, as we come to the cure of that, we must at the beginning of that modify the patient with the cristeri which extracts all the fissure which is in their bowels; because that fissure sometimes prohibits the entry of the stone, and the inquiry of it.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	And then place the patient on their feet and sit them down and make them cough so that the stone descends to the neck of the bladder, or what jumps from the place or some times.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And then make that cezer between your hands prepared, and the hands of it be below the things of it, so that the bladder is entirely made declining to the lower parts.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And then pierce that and all of it through.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Therefore, if you feel the stone in the space, then you immediately take care with section over it.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if you do not catch all with your touch, then you must that you anoint with oil your said index of the left hand, if the patient is a child, or the said middle if it is a young complete, and introduce that into their anus.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And pierce of the stone until it stays below your said.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And convert that little by little into the neck of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	And then press upon that with your said, and expel that to the outside parts, where the place of which you made the section.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	And command the minister to press the bladder with his hand; and command another minister that with his right hand extend the genitals to the upper parts, and with his other hand re-make the codena which is below the genitals, in the part of the place where the section is made.

And cut in it the water that is between the anus and the genitals, not in the middle place, but on the left side of the vagina; and let the section be over that stone and your said be in the anus, and let it be made transversely, so that the section outside be wide and inside narrow according to the quantity that exits of the stone be possible, and no more, because very strong compress the said which is in the anus the stone and it is forced-thrown its faculty.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And know that there is a certain kind of foot that has an angle and margins, so that the removal of it is made difficult by this.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And of that one, that which is like a gland, is round, and it is made of it light removal.

E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not thus formed, then cover what you have on that, or what you grasp on that with a decent gesture, the extremity of which is like a file with which you grasp on the foot, and do not release it; or you interpose a subtle instrument of curved extremity.

And if the foot is very large, then ignorance is that you cut into it with a large section, because it happens to the patient one of two causes: either it dies or it becomes a continuous distillation of urine, because the area is not altogether consolidated.

And when you have untied that, embrocate the place with water and a little oil, and then cure that with a diaphanition gargle and a diazilicon gargle while it is healing.

E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	And cover during all the hours of the healing that you lie both things and adjust the medicines which are placed on the spot.

de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	of a triangular extremity, sharp, fitted into a shaft.

De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	Of the extraction of a foot from women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	A foot in women is rarely engendered.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	But if a foot is seen in any of those, then the healing of it is difficult, and it is prohibited by troops of manners.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of them is that the woman is very likely to be a virgin.

Capitol lxii.	Chapter LXII.
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	Of incision about hernia.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	Hernia ayguoza is nothing but an accumulation of humidity in the white membrane which is below the codena of the genitals containing the huou, and it is called membrane.
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	And sometimes it is in the proper panniculus which nature has prepared it in the part of the huou, before it is cuyat that it already is another huou; and it is the codena of the genitals between the white membrane which we have said, and it is not that but tart.
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	And the generation of this hernia is by weakness which happens to the genitals, so that to those this matter is poured, and sometimes it happens by percussion made upon the genitals.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	And this humidity is having many colors, for the color of it or is declining to citrine or to sanguine, or rouge, or it is black and feculent, or it is aqueous white, and that is the most.
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	And the signals by which it is known where this accumulation of water is this: for if it is in the white membrane which we have said, then the abscess is round declining a little to length as such as the figure of a huou, and appears the genitals, for the humidity contains that of all parts.
E si la humiditat es en le propri pannicol, lahoras le apostema es redon am partida del huou e per aysso hom estima que es autre huou.	And if the humidity is in the proper panniculus, then the abscess is round in the part of the huou and therefore one estimates that it is another huou.
E si la humiditat es entre la codena dels genetius e·l ciphac blanc, lahoras catz dejos le centiment.	And if the humidity is between the codena of the genitals and the white membrane, then catz below the centiment.
E cum tu vols la cognicio de la color de la humiditat, lahoras tu esproa la color de la humiditat en le apostema am entromes cayrat del qual la forma es precedida; e segon aquo que es eyssit en le vestigi del entromes, jutga de aquo que es dedintz lu.	And as you want the knowledge of the color of the humidity, then you probe the color of the humidity in the abscess with an introduced catheter of which the form is preceded; and according to what is seen in the vestige of the catheter, judge of what is contained in it.
Donc quan nos vinem a la curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que comandem al malaute que sia fleubotomat si aquo es a tu possibla, e vezes le cos de lu ple.	Therefore, when we come to the cure of it with iron, then we must command the patient to be fleubotomized if that is possible to you, and times the body of him full.
E aprop sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos sobre alcuna causa un pauc auta, e pausa dejos lu motz draps.	And after that, be resuspended over his two on some cause a little high, and put below him many cloths.
E aprop setz tu sobre la part sinistra de lu, e comanda al ministra que segua a la dextra de lu, le qual extenda la sua vergua a hun de dos latz a la codena dels genetius e a la partida del mirac del ventre.	And then sit you on the left side of him, and command the minister to follow on the right side of him, the one who extends his rope to one of two sides to the groin and to the part of the navel of the belly.
E aprop pren spatum lat e scindeys la codena dels genetius del mieg loc per la longitut entro prop le pentenilh.	And then take a spatula wide and split the groin of the patient from the middle point along the length until you reach the penis.
E sia fayta la seccio segon rectetut engualment distant de la linha que deveseys la pel dels genetius, entro que pervengua al ciphac blanc comprehendent.	And make the section according to rectum, equally distant from the line that you should follow the skin of the genitals, until you reach the white cyph, encompassing.
E excorja aquel, e observa, e guarda te per aysso que tu no inscidas aquel; e la tua excoriacio am la qual aquel excorjas per partida jassia que sia suspenduda am le huou mays e subtilment escruta am la excoriacio segon la quantitat a tu possibla.	And scrape that, and observe, and guard yourself so that you do not cut that; and your scraping with which you scrape by a gentle partition that may be suspended with the most subtle and carefully examine with the scraping according to the quantity as much as possible.
E aprop perfora le ciphac ple de aygua am perforacio ampla, e extratz tota l’aygua.	And then perforate the cyph full of water with a wide perforation, and extract all the water.
E aprop separa entre doas labias de la seccio am uncis, e exten le ciphac a las partidas desus; e no toques la codena les genetius comprehendent, e inscideys le ciphac en aquela manieyra que es a tu possible.	And then separate between the two labia of the section with a hook, and extend the cyph to the upper parts; and do not touch the groin encompassing, and cut the cyph in that manner as much as is possible.
E inscideys aquel am la sua totalitat o en pessas, e majorment le sieu latz subtil, quar si tu no perscrutas exquisidament la inscizio de lu, no es fayta segurtat que la aygua no retorne.	And cut that with its totality or in pieces, and mostly its subtle side, for if you do not scrutinize exquisitely the incision of it, it is not done with certainty that the water will not return.
Mays si le huou procezeys de aquela defora de la sua codena en la ora de la tua operacio, lahoras quan tu auras complida la seccio del ciphac, retorna dedintz aquel, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la codena dels genetius am sutura, e aprop cura aquel ayssi cum las autras plagua, entro que sia sanat.	But if the fluid proceeds from that outside of its groin in the time of your operation, then when you will have completed the section of the cyph, return it inside, and then adjust the two labia of the groin of the genitals with suture, and then care for it as with other plagues, until it is healed.
E si atrobas le huou corromput per autra malautia, lahoras cove que tu lies les vayssels les quals so sore le suspensori, e extrat le huou, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit.	And if you find the fluid corrupted by another malady, then cover that you cut the vessels that are on the suspensory, and extract the fluid, and then care for it with the water that we have said.
Mays si l’aygua es agreguada en doas partidas esemps, lahoras sapias que doas son las ernias; donc inscideys aquela partida segon que has feyt en l’autra engualment; e si es a tu vist que sia una opera, lahoras tu la fay.	But if the water is aggregated in two parts simultaneously, then you know that there are two hernias; therefore cut that partition according to what you have done in the other equally; and if it is to your view that it should be an operation, then you do it.
E aprop tu abstergiys le sanc, e entramet en las seccios lana submersa en oli o en oli rozat; e pausa deforo autra lana la qual tu as submersa en vi e oli, e expandeys aquela sobre dos genetius e·l mirac del ventre; e pausa desobre draps doblatz e pulvils, e lia aquels desobre am liament le qual es segon aquesta forma:	And then you cleanse the blood, and introduce into the sections wool submerged in oil or in rose oil; and place before other wool which you have submerged in wine and oil, and expand that over the genitals and the navel of the belly; and place over cloths folded and powders, and tie those above with a bandage which is according to this form:

e es asemblat a letra greca.	And it is assembled like a Greek letter.

E sia la apercio ampla entro que corro tota l‘aygua.	And let the aperture be wide until all the water runs out.

But if contrariety is in the emission of the water in that hour you perforate that: and this is not done otherwise than because the white panniculus in the orifice of the plague makes contrariety and prohibits the emission of the water, then cover that you put in the plague a probe or instrument with which is extracted the water from the hydropitz, the form of which is preceded; or adjust in the oppression of the plague a small one.

Sapias que en la seccio sobre aquesta hernia es temor perdusent a pernicia en las majors disposicios; per que a mi es vista la dimissio de lu e esser salvat per aquela milhor. Donc, dic que l‘apostemas natz en les cos dels quals les genetius so conponutz e es fayt aquo per motas causas: o per superfluitat aguda agra, la qual es efundida als genetius, o per percuscio.	Therefore, I say that the abscesses arise in the bodies of those whose genitals are composed and this is done for many causes: either by acute superfluity, which is poured into the genitals, or by percussion.
E es la color de la apostema segon la color del cos, e no es atrobat en lu dolor, e es apostema greu.	And the color of the abscess is according to the color of the body, and it is not troubled in it pain, and it is a serious abscess.
E fort leu es apostema lapificada, del qual la color es fosca, e no es centiment a lu.	And very few is the abscess lapidified, of which the color is dark, and there is no feeling in it.
E alcunas veguadas es fayt per nodacio de las arcerias, e per imflacio de aquelas ayssi quo ja es perceubut la rememoracio de lu, o per imflacio de venas. Mays aquo que es per imflacio de arcerias es conogut per la dispercio de la apostema quan compremas aquela am les tieus ditz; e no cove que aquel toques. Mays aquel que es fayt per imflacio de vena no es dispergut de lu alcuna causa deves la compressio am les ditz.	But that which is made by the inflation of veins is not dispersed of it any cause of you the compression with your fingers.

Capitol .lxv.	Chapter .lxv.
De la cura de hernia entestinal.	Of the cure of intestinal hernia.
Le adveniment de aquesta hernia es per seccio que endeve en le ciphac extendut sobre le ventre de part dels angunars del mirac del ventre, per que deysendo les budels de aquela ruptura ad alcu dels budels. E aquesta ruptura es o del ciphac o de excencio de lu, e accideysso aquestas doas specias per motas causas: o percussio, o per sautz, o per clamor, o per elevacio de alcuna causa greu, o per semblantz.
