E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And it is necessary for the phlebotomist that one be over-fear in the phlebotomy of it, because below that is a nerve; and therefore if it adjusts in the puncture of the phlebotomy and touches the nerve, it will cause stupor to it, and it is difficult the healing of it, and fort it is not healed of all, and this nerve many times appears to the feeling; and if it is hidden to some men and is subtle and is not shown, then it is necessary that you pause the phlebotomy with the one with which you phlebotomize with a incision of the knife, and avoid the nerve with your strength.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is between two nerves, then you fen the vein in the longitude.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The benefit of the phlebotomy of the cephalica vein is that it attracts the blood from the head and comforts the ailments of the joints.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	And it is necessary in this very properly, if you want that the phlebotomy be done with a phlebotomy of olive or with a phlebotomy of myrtle; because it is the safest of all the veins, because it is not below it the artery nor the nerve.
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	But however it is necessary for you that in the phlebotomy you guard that with the phlebotomy you do not prick the head of the lacert so only, and seek the place most light, and do not notice to it, unless it is touched with the first percussion that be over it with the phlebotomy several times.
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	But however fort it is an apostemat in some men, when it is not phlebotomized in the first percussion, but do not notice in re that apostema.
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	But the quality of the phlebotomy of it and its accidents are many, in which you must think in their rectification.
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first of these is that you should know that phlebotomy is not administered except in the preservation of health and in the hope of it and the precaution of the occurrence of illnesses, and that phlebotomy should be performed on one of the veins that are in the arm, namely: cephalic, basilic and median; and that it should be performed at the beginning of spring, fasting in spring and autumn, and in winter near the meal, when signs of repletion appear.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	And it should be performed phlebotomy on the third day or at the first hour that three hours have passed from the day.
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	But phlebotomy that is administered, more when it provokes convenience and necessity to it, either at night or during the day, at any hour and at any time.
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	And that a child should not be phlebotomized before they have fourteen years, and a woman who is pregnant should not be phlebotomized except from the fourth month to the seventh, and the elderly should not be phlebotomized those who have already passed sixty years.
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	And since whoever wants to be phlebotomized in any way, should purify their bowels before phlebotomy with a lion's enema, if in those there is a lot of retained feces, so that the veins do not withdraw the superfluities in the phlebotomy of the bowels, which are purified, and that they do not harm the main limbs.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	And should not be phlebotomized patients with nausea, certain vomiting, or who are suffering from illness or intoxication until that has been removed from them, nor those with dropsy, and more than phlebotomy should be feared near colic, vomiting, and abdominal pain, and near multiplication of copulation and labor and exercise of fasting or vigils and from every cause that dissolves the virtue, whether corporeal or animal.
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	And consider in the subtilization of humors before it, if the blood is thick, with foods and drinks, and with medicines if it is possible to it.
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	And introduce into a bath if no cause prohibits it, or exercise through any exercise so that the blood is subtiliated.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	And pause the phlebotomy of him in the foot of the day, that is, around the hour of terce, as we have said.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	And perforate that the foot of that be guarded on that day from all evils accidents animals, as is anguish, anger, fear, and from all corporal accidents, as is labor and superfluous pain and copulation and semblance to them.
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	And to his seizure make to be present the causes in the use of which custom of men by aromaticity and odor and by balsams and semblance to those according to the quantity of possibility.
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	And follow the phlebotomist on a cushion that is more soft than the cushion of the one who is to be phlebotomized.
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	And then extract his arm, and rub that with his hand the phlebotomist two or three times; and then tighten the ligament with a strip and wrap that two times.
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	And let the stricture be temperate, for the stricture when it is not equal, or the stricture is with superfluity, then prohibit the flux of the blood; or is with softening, and then prohibit the body of the blood ascent.
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	And after the stricture, let him who is to be phlebotomized rub his hands together meanwhile until the veins are inflated and declared to the touch.
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	And after the phlebotomist anoints his phlebotomy with a little of oil, properly; and let him place his left hand's index finger over that vein, below the place where he wants the phlebotomy, so that the vein be pushed a little, and the percussion be seated because of the veins is the one that atrophies as if the heart flees, and of those is that is full of vitality and when he places the phlebotomy on it, it is contracted, and the phlebotomist is discovered; and the phlebotomy does not pierce the vein, and if it pierces, then that is straitened.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	And therefore, for this, let the phlebotomist be stopped and be solicited in all these causes.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	And after the phlebotomy, but if the vein is pierced in one go, then it is good; and otherwise, you repeat it another time below that place a little, or on it with a festin, if the place is not apostatized.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	And if the place is apostatized, or the patient fears, then you leave it for a day or two, and do not tighten the ligament, for it will strongly pull the abscess caut, nor enter into a bath.
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	And after repeat the phlebotomy if the need.
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	And if the aperture is small and the blood flows subtly, and you fear that there will not be the quantity of blood that you want, then you repeat the phlebotomy in that tract according to rectitude and adjust in the aperture a little, and do it with a festin before the place is apostatized, because the place is apostatized in many men because of a small aperture.
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	But if it is already apostatized, then do not repeat on it, because it excuses you for no cause; and pause on it some part of the incision of oil, because it alleviates the body of the blood.
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And it is better in this place than oil and than the other oils.
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	And seemingly administers a fenda of oil in all fleubotomia with which fleubotomes the veins of the prohibition of the body of blood, and do that tyriaca alfadoc and sagzenea when is placed from one of those on the spot, because the blood is subtiliated and is revolvut when is gross.
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	And if in the place of the fleubotomia is engendered great abscess, because many times happens, and mostly to him who has not been bled but that time, or at the opening of the vein little, and then you take, and place on the spot sponge soaked in water and salt, a little scalded, and strengthen that for an hour, because it is dissolved.
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	And cover that do this near the issuance of the blood of that vein with complement of it or of another vein.
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	And if remains in the place for some days some blackness or greenness, do not notice it; and if you want, place on that some cause of aloen and of myrrh dissolved, or some cause of juice of mint or of calamint or similar to it.
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	And many times happens abscesses and eminences because fleubotomia of the basilica.
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	And therefore place your hand on that, and if then you feel softness because of your compression on that, then that eminence is bad and evil; and therefore beware that you place on that any cause of that which have been said, because it will flow strongly from the artery blood.
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And make a plaster with that which is astringent, so that the place be endured, and then cure that with the other cure until it is healed.
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	And cover that you extract blood to every man according to the quantity of his virtue and according to the color which appears on the blood according to what appears.
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	Because if the blood is black, then you let it issue until it is red; and seemingly if you see it thick, then you let it issue until it is subtiliated; and seemingly if it is acute, until the acuteness of it is stayed.
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat. E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	And in him who is frail, be done the contrary of that, and cover that you extract that in troops of times, and that the trauc be strait.
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	And the best that is administered in fleubotomia of vein is that it be the transverse section, not puncture.
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	And this manner of fleubotomia is safe from flux of blood and of incision of nerves, and is more praiseworthy and more safe than fleubotomia according to latitude and longitude.
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	And to which it is customary to happen syncope because of the fleubotomia, and cover that you cure that before the fleubotomia with a little of bread soaked in wine of millegrains or of simple oxymel scalded; and extract to l u of the blood in three times or four.
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	And if it is cold constitution, then pregna before the fleubotomia pa soaked in essence of myrrh or in essence of honey flavored with spices as well as pepper, cinnamon, ginger and similar, or in essence aromatized and much odorous.
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	And if happens syncope because of the fleubotomia, and is cause of it issuance of much blood, then cover that you pregna in drink water of meat and essence much odorous subtle; and use of aromaticity with algualea, and be liniment the their feet with that.
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	And use of the other causes that have been said in the division in the chapter of syncope by evacuation.
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	And he who wants to even the his arm and dissolve the his blood according to time, cover to him of which the fleubotomia is for much evacuation, and the virtue of him is frail, that evacuate the blood little by little, so it is according to the quantity of the virtue in the continuous days.
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	May who wants to even the his arm, and give it the his blood according to the second time, and the his body is strong, then do that about seven hours or nine of the first fleubotomia.

Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	May that body in which is much blood already scalded and is acute and makes happen fever, cover that it be given of it blood in one time and be of it thrown a great quantity and be amplified the aperture until it happens syncope, because you will have conserved all the conditions of fleubotomia; and that you place your hand on the wrist of it because of the body of the blood, so that it does not become death in place of syncope, because many times it happens that when the fleubotomist is ignorant and negligent.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal. E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is suppurating, then leave that one and do not touch it until the abscess is settled.

And the quality of the phlebotomy of it is that the patient inserts their hand in warm water until the phlebotomy site reddens and the vein appears manifestly.

And then tie it above that ligament with a tight bandage; and phlebotomize according to the small transverse, not longitudinally nor according to the length.

Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	But if you were in the days of summer, then you are excused from the repetition of the hand in the warm water, and the mesh is placed the body of the blood in warm water in time of winter.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the phlebotomy of this vein is safer than all the others, because it has no pulsating vein, nor nerve.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And the phlebotomy of the saphenous vein of the right hand is congruent to the diseases of the liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re. And if the phlebotomist errs in the first attempt, then repeat with the phlebotomy in a little, because the place is safe; and do not fear of it malice, but that you guard yourself from the nerves as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And similarly do of the saphenous vein of the other foot equally.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And of the sciatic vein, the place as we have said is below the heel of the left side.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the benefit of the phlebotomy of it is to pain of the hip when it is by blood clot.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the quality of the phlebotomy of it is that the patient enters in bath, and fastens and tightens the skin of it from the side of the wide below the heel under four fingers with a long thin bandage, so that it appears not by it.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And therefore when it appears, then you phlebotomize it according to each engine that is to you possible and according to the transverse, and it is better; or incise it by incision or cut it by section, because the place of it is safe.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is in many men well-known; and if you find that, and it does not appear to the feeling of all, then phlebotomize some branch of it, and it is that which appears in the back of the foot opposite the auricular and the annular.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And guard yourself of the nerves, and make run the quantity of blood that you want.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	And then loosen the stricture and place over the area of the phlebotomy cut and tighten the area, slightly it is healed.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of suction and of the qualities of using those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Suctions are of horns, or of glass, or of wood.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And suction is made in two ways: one of them is with scarification and extraction of blood, and the other is suction without scarification.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this suction that is without scarification is in two ways, whether it is with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And to the suctions that are administered with scarification and extraction of blood there are fourteen places of the body, of which one in which suctions are placed is the occiput, and it is the back part of the head; and the middle place of the two parts of the neck together; and suction of the chin below the jaw below the mouth; and suction of the two shoulder blades; and suction of the hypochondrium, and it is above the end of the rib; and suction of the two armpits; and suction of the two groins.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And suction does not extract the blood but of the small veins scattered in the flesh, and therefore it does not catch the virtue through those, as it is caught by phlebotomy; nor is it advisable that suction be made with fire or without fire in any illness caused by repletion until the whole body is evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if necessity provokes suction for illness or for continuation, administer it at every hour at the beginning of the month and at the end of it, and in the middle of it and in any time it may be.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause is that of those men in whom the blood is multiplied within that it is indigested of its extraction by suction and finds in their head heaviness and soddenness; and of those it is that finds repletion and rigor in their face and in their head, and in their neck; and of those it is that finds pruziment in their face and in their forehead and darkness and hebetude in their eyes; and of those that vomit the place of their suction; and of those it is that their ris is multiplied; and of those it is that finds taste of blood in their mouth, or that the tongue is apostate and spits blood; and of those it is that their sleep is multiplied, and of those that vomit blood in their sleep rigor and ancients and plagues and other causes to their semblance.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore when it happens in any cause of those, and properly if it is in the third or middle of the month, then command suction to be made more than it has passed from the day two or three hours.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the benefit of suction of the neck is that when it confers the gravity in the head and ad that which is poured into the eyes; but it is advisable that that be near evacuation of the whole body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this suction is in the place of phlebotomy of the cephalic.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not light that use of it that one who is of cold complexion, or in which is catarrh, for it gives to that great harm.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And for that reason it is not advisable that use of it the old, and in the heads of which are cold illnesses.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But to that one who over that it is continuing over it is made oblivion; and for that reason it is advisable that you command the suction-maker that pause his hand a little with the suction to the parts below, fearing the generation of oblivion.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	But suction of the armpit is in the place of phlebotomy of the vena fusca and of the basilica: and for that reason it confers to asthma, and to the constriction of the ale and to the scissura of the sturment of ale, and to cough, and to repletion.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And it is advisable that the armpit suction be peeled a little, for if it is placed below, it generates weakness in the body and in the stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And the suction of the forehead confers to the pains accident in the head and to ophthalmia, and migraine, and pre-focus, and pains in the roots of the teeth; and it is in the place of phlebotomy of the basilica.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And it is advisable that you command the suction-maker that he not press his hand with scarification for that he not pierce the artery and that there occur fluxes of blood.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And suction below the chin confers to alcohol in the mouth, and to corruption of the gums, and semblance to those of the illnesses that are in the mouth, and stand in the place of phlebotomy of aliheric that is in the two lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But the suction that is made over the two shoulder blades confers to caphatan, which is made by repletion of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And the suction of the two armpit parts confers benefit of phlebotomy of three veins, so it is of the basilica, fusca and cephalic, for that one attracts the blood of all those veins more numerous that are in the flesh, and those veins smaller of the other veins more gross as it may reach the attraction to the three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And command the suction-maker that too much he does not proceed in scarification, for the place is denuded of flesh, and below it are nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is a suction with which is suctioned over the buttocks and confers to the hemorrhoids of the anus and to the ulcers below.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And tell the ventilator to make a large ventilation, and that it be of fire, because the place needs a strong incision; and very light and subtle ventilations should be made and it should be scarified with a scarification.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	But smaller ventilations on the legs are made with less manifestation, because they draw the blood of the whole body, and they are similar to old pains of the lungs and the womb, and of the bladder; and they provoke menstruation, and they are similar to bothor and ademil; and they are in place of fleubotomia of two sophenas, and alahorcoben, and of two cavilhas.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	But many weaken the whole body and cause syncope in many men.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And of the ventilations alahorcoben the judgment is proper to the judgment to the ventilations of two legs.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the quality of the position of the ventilations is that you pause the ventilation at the beginning and suck it with a temperate suction, and do not prolong the position of the ventilations, but pause them lightly, and move them carefully, and that the humors come to the place by equal arrival.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease to iterate this and continue until you see the place already red and inflate and that the color of the blood appears.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And then you scarify and iterate the suction little by little, and then consider in the disposition of the body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	Because that man who has tender flesh of rare pores, you should scarify him once and no more, so that the place is not ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And command the ventilator to amplify the scarification and proceed a little, and temper the suction with facility.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if in the blood there is thickness, then you should scarify twice, because in the first scarification the way of subtilization to the blood and its liquidity is opened.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second to the scrutiny acquired of the extraction of the thick blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very foul, then the third scarification should be made so that it can achieve the last.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	And finally, when we want to extract the blood little by little or a little, one scarification is enough for us.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want the extraction of much blood, we scarify with many scarifications; and if we knew that the blood is thick, then we should scarify with a pre-determined scarification.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the term of scarification in which is the depth of the cut only.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if that one whose cut is thick, hard, dark, and whose pores are narrow, it is necessary that the places of the ventilations be anointed more gently, more open, more resolved; if it is in summer, as is oil of aloes or oil of violets, or oil of two almonds, or oil of quince; and if it is in winter, then oil of narcissus, or oil of lily, or oil of chamomile, or of sanc, and to those similar.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the superfluity is thick, fried, then the oil should be of amaranth, or oil of balsamita, or oil of aloes, or oil of aneti, and to those similar.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the ventilator is of wide pores of tender flesh, then it should be prohibited from oil, and it should be given to these the places of the ventilations of their vicinity the ventilation should be washed with waters or with cold water of solatrum, or with water of quince, or with water of bordolaguas, and similar to those.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And that one whose blood is of much humidity, washes his ventilations with strong wine, or with water of myrtle and sumac and similar to those.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And of that one whose superfluities are thick, washes his ventilations with old wine, or with water of sansuc, which is majorana, or of decoction of aneti, or of chamomile, and to those similar.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And that the ventilation should be guarded before bathing; bathing should be administered near the bath for an hour or two, and that sleep near the ventilation.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is necessary for the ventilator to be regulated before phlebotomy.
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	You should consider at the beginning: then if the ventilator or the one who is to be fleubotomized is choleric and windy, and has blood acute and inflammation, then it is necessary to precede with cooling causes, such as vinegar, endive, wine, lettuce, and secanabin, and julep, and similar to those.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And pause their foods as much as possible, and birds' meats, and foods seasoned with acids, and similar to them.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And of that one whose complexion is cold, it is necessary to precede with drinking syrup of almiva, or syrup of alsecanabin of seeds, and sumac, and wine very fragrant between old and new; and that he should be commanded to use little drinking and eating, and pause his foods as much as possible and canary and sparrow and small birds and doves.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And that on the day of ventilation and phlebotomy, the drink should be greater than the food.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And that on certain hours to some men, tyriaca alpharac, or medicines of musk, that is muscada, or alcelita should be given before ventilation or phlebotomy or near, so that the principal members be comforted and the blood be subtiliated; and that they should not take that scalfatz.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	But the wounds that are incisions should be incisions that are placed on the liver, and on the spleen and gout, and on the navel, in the places of the joints, and the part of the groin, because these members do not suffer incisions on themselves.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not desired for those (wounds) but traction of blood from the limb, just as you place a suction cup on the nipple in the illness of blood flow from the nose; and use it so that the cold suction, hidden from the limb, is dissolved, just as you place it on the belly and the navel; because it thins the limb and warms it and removes the pain because it resolves the suction.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it is already placed on the boils when they occur in their inflammation or pimple, because by virtue of the strong traction, the pus is drawn out and eradicates the pimple from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly it does when it is placed on the liver and spleen, suction is applied in those enclosed places.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these incisions are administered with suction alone; and sometimes they are administered with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And sometimes they are administered full of tepid water in the illnesses of the spleen.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is because the incision should be filled and be larger, so it is tepid water alone or water in which herbs have been boiled to the appropriate water.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of incision administered with fire: its width is two fingers, as we have formed it; and the quantity of the preon is the majority of a palm; and it is in the middle of it, in the place that is in the circuit, the majority of it, the track is small according to the quantity that enters into it a needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	It should be made of a  thick, round, lion-shaped, smooth and  polished piece so that it does not damage the limb with its position on it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And in the middle of it, a transverse bar of iron or steel is placed, on which a candle is placed with the fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And already this incision is larger than the one we have recounted; and the few (incisions) are less than that according to the illnesses and the state of him who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the incisions of the infants and emaciated are others than the incisions of the young and of strong bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of placing this incision with fire on the limb is that it extends the fire with firewood decently in front of a small candle of wax, and place it on the middle of the transverse bar in the middle place of the incision, so that the fire is ignited around the part below so that it does not burn the body of the patient.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then it is placed on the limb of the patient, and the finger is on the track that we have said, and when we have the incisions and we do not indicate that we show the finger and that it escapes the vapor on that track, then the incision is dissolved immediately.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And then prop the fire according to its manner, and repeat that if it is indicated by that.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But in the incision that is administered in the illness of pleurisy, with water, in which there is no transverse bar nor track, and it is not administered unless it is filled with water, and it is placed on the limb alone.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is the form of it: And this incision as much as it is larger, it is better, because it can receive a large quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter .xcvii.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Bloodletting is not administered in all members but in the members in which it is not possible to place incisions, because of the smallness of those, such as the ear and gums and similar to them; or in a member devoid of flesh, such as the finger and nose and their similar.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those that have been found leeches that are in the waters of the muddy pools.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And then they are laid the day and night in muddy water until they are famished, and that no cause remains in the belly of those; and then it is evacuated the body at the beginning with phlebotomy and with incisions; and then it is cooled the limb of the patient until it reddens; and then they are placed on it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And as they are filled and case.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible suction of the place with an incision, it is more helpful.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the place with vinegar and then with a lot of water; and be rubbed and squeezed.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the flow of blood is prolonged after the placement of the leeches, and this is the result, then you put a cloth of linen in cold water, and place that on top until the bleeding is stopped.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the blood is multiplied, then pulverize on it vitriol trias, or  galls and similar to those of the causes stiptics, until the blood is stopped; or they are placed on the place the halves of boiled beans, and they are laid until the beans adhere to the place, and the blood is stopped.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And cover, if necessary, repetition of leeches, when it is possible to change those.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the leeches are prohibited from suspension, then the place is rubbed with recent blood or a needle is left in the places until blood escapes; and then they are placed, because those when they feel some blood immediately adhere.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to relax, sprinkle a little crushed aloe, or salt, or ash, on those, and then cover them.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the chapter of the third part: of restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very necessary in the art of medicine; and the restoration of fractures and dislocations that occur in the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, son, know that these foolish doctors and the vulgar boast of this chapter, and those who never regard the books of the Ancients nor read even a letter from them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason it has happened that this manner of the learned in our land is deprived; and you must not forget this at any time, well, and I have not adopted this that I teach, but for the length of reading the books of the Ancients and study over the understanding of those, until I extracted the science from those.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And then I turned to experiment and study in the length of my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter all that my science contains and on which my best experiment has been passed; because I have now abridged it for you others and delivered it from the occupation of elongation; and I have abridged it in the end of abridgment; and I have shown it in the end of declaration; and I have formed many forms of the instruments that are administered in it, as it has been done by addition of declaration, as I have done in the two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summaries and collections from the essence of bone fractures, from those whose preface is necessary before we begin the remembrance of broken and various members, each and every one.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, I say that in the preface of this chapter, we should speak of the summaries of the sermon; and the chapters, whose understanding at the beginning is forced upon the artificers, and they stand upon the truth of those; so it is for you and those who are quick to know or learn this noble art other than yourselves.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore I say that when you happen upon a fracture or dislocation or sprain or wound, then you must, at the beginning, apply yourself to phlebotomy or to alleviate that, or one and the other, if no cause prohibits, as if due to lack of virtue, or the one to whom you attend is a child, or old in decrepitude, or the time is of vehement heat, or of vehement cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And then let him be content in his food of fresh herbs and of birds' meat and of crabs; and forbid him thick meats and fill him with foods and all foods that fill the veins with blood, until you are sure of a cauterized abscess, and if you fear effusion of matter to the limb.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to his first regimen, to which he is accustomed.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And therefore, as the broken bone begins to be restored, then the patient must be fed with nutritious foods of nourishment, thick and heavy in which there is viscosity, as such foods made of boiled wheat with water, and rice, and capons, and fish, and bellies of cows, and eggs, and fresh poultry, and thick meat and similar to those, and with this regimen is made coagulation of fracture more lightly and better.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that the bones that are broken in men who are in the first childhood and in the decrepit, it is not possible that they be continued and consolidated according to their nature by the drying of their limbs.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and continued according to their nature all times by the drying of those limbs, and they are continued and consolidated those that are of them at the end of the softness, as the bones of the little infants.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	However, nature adjusts and unites on the broken bone from every part any cause seeming to glut in which there is thickness that adheres and strengthens it until it is simultaneously conglutinated and tied together, until they come to the end of fortitude and firmness, as fire at the beginning, until no cause prohibits it from its works.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason it is necessary that you pause the patient's foods, foods in which there is heaviness and viscosity and thickness, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Many varieties of fracture according to the variety of the member.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the species of fracture are diverse according to the diversity of the members, for the fracture of the bone of the leg is diverse from the fracture of the bone of the head; and the fracture of the bone of the foot is diverse from the fracture of the bone of the hand; and similarly all the other members are diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I come with remembrance of every species of fracture, explained in its distinct chapter from the other.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Many varieties of fracture within itself.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And they are diversified the species of fracture of the bone in themselves; for there is an arched fracture, another that happens in stars; and sometimes it is made a fracture according to the length of the bone: and in the fractures of the saddle and stars and additions proceeding and not proceeding, as it is done in the pen when it is prepared to write, and it is a fracture with plaque and disruption in the head, and it is a small fissure fracture.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And to every species is engendered or torment proper in the restoration of it according to that which will come remembrance of it distinct in its places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Many signs of fracture of the bone.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And by this is known the fracture of the bone: it is the twisting of it, and from that prominence and appearance of it to the touch, and so of it when you compress it with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore when there is no apparent twisting in the place, nor is it felt when you touch the bone with agitation and the patient does not feel great pain, then there is no fracture here.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	However, it is possible that there is a small twisting or fissure, so that you must feel it with your hand and with compression of the whole; however, place upon it of the medicines of which recollection is made at this moment, the one that convenes to the place; and then apply a stricture subtly.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that the place when it is arched and not split in two or otherwise that does not happen in it, such as it is remaugued all of its part, then you must begin from your hour to the rectification of it, however, that it happens after a cautery abscess.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if it happens abscess cautery, then leave it for some days until the abscess ceases; and then bandage it according to whichever manner that you can of lightness and of ingenuity.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And know that the restoration of it and the sharpening of it is less severe than of the bone in which such a sathagie has happened.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then strengthen it according to that which will come the recollection of it.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if in the bone there are satagias, then it is necessary extension of this broken limb of two parts, if it is the arm or the leg; or with your hand if the limb is small; or with two cords or with one cord and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And be the position with which you pause the limb, the one that enguals according to its natural figure, while the parts are extended of the broken limb, then you must perforate that you make return those additions with ingenuity and according to whichever manner that you can in their places.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And guard yourself according to your force that it does not happen upon the patient by your operation pain nor lesion; and perforate yourself according to your power that you apply one bone with the other its companion according to their best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And you must in that hour profitably touch with your hand that, and if you see here any other cause, rectify that and bandage it for the quantity of your virtue.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid vehement extension and compression, as such as foolish doctors do who, with movements, often cause abscess cautery by their operation, or cause contraction in the limb as we have seen by the operation of their movements.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And then annex, apply, decent operation and stricture of that limb, and rest and tranquility; admonish the patient about this and make him swear that he will not hurt that in the hour of his vigils and of his sleeping, and see his revolution and agitation, and you must his egestion, and you must all his movements with all his virtue; and wait until that the position of the limb is a position with which is secured the pain, the cause is when he feels in the disposition of the position of the limb pain or lesion; then you must change that to another disposition of that with which he does not feel pain; and guard with this that the position of it that be straight and equal, so that to the limb does not happen twisting when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the stricture of the tranquil limb is that which I recommend; for that you know that the broken limbs are diversified in their smallness and in their greatness and in the form of those.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And of those that are small as the arm and the hand and the foot and similar to those, then you must the envelopment be of very fine cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But those that are gross as the thigh or the leg, then you must in those be envelopment broad and hard, for the broad liament connects the great limb and strengthens that of all parts with equal stricture, in such a way that in it no macula enters.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And then, as you begin, your evacuation of equacio, pause liament convenient to this, upon the place of that fracture with three envelopment or four according to that the member merits; and strengthen your hand a little with the liament.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then see to that at the part more sovereign of the place of the fracture, and strengthen less so that you do not focus your stricture with which you have strengthened the place of the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then lengthen yourself with envelopment of the place of the fracture a little, and mollify the stricture little by little, until you take of the place a great part.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and envelop that other time over the broken place with envelopment, and then see to the envelopment at the part farther from the fracture; and be your operation in the stricture of the envelopment and in the mollification of that according to that we have said in the first envelopment below.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then pause between the envelopment of stopa lion or cloth with which is equalized the twisting of the fracture, if in it is twisting; and if not, do not pause in it any cause.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then pause over it another bandage, and then bandage over these envelopment stars decently made as soon as, if in the place there is no inflammation or abscess caut, and then pause over it that which seizes the abscess and that oste the inflammation; and leave that for some days; and then you strengthen over it the stars.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And the stakes should be of the majority of cane, well-formed; or of pine wood; or of palm branches; and the width of each stake should be according to this form and this figure:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, it is necessary that the stake placed upon that fracture be thicker and a little larger than the others, and the length of the stake according to what is seen in the limb in magnitude and smallness; and then strengthen over the stakes with another bandage according to your first stricture; and then tie it underneath decently according to what we have said of stricture, and it is that it be the stricture according to the place of the fracture more, and as much as the fracture is elongated, the less the stricture.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And it is necessary that the threads be medium in thickness and subtlety, and be of silk; and if the threads are coarse, as I have seen in the operation of some fools placing their threads of cords of hemp, and it is a great error, when the stricture is outside equality.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And excessively fine threads are not convenient, because you will not be able to make a stricture with those that you want, and it is necessary that between stake and stake there be at least one finger's width.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is said to be in pain at the extremities of the stakes near the stricture in those places, then place some wool or carded wool between them so that it does not cause him injury.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes a fracture is with a plague, and accidents happen in the bone, and I will come with a remedy in that in the chapter according to singularity.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And know that not all broken limbs are straightened with stakes on the first day; the reason is that the limb, when it is large, should not be placed upon them stakes but rather about five days or seven or more, according to your certainty of the advent of a boil caut.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the manner of the plasters with which the Ancients restored, the ones which were placed upon fractures and dislocations and twists.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Manner of plastering as a bruised restoration of fracture, convenient to many complications and mostly to women and children, because it is of that upon which no heat nor cold comes: and it is that you take of flour powder, and it is the medulla of the flour that remains from the movement of the mill in the walls of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And mix that as it is, unless that you sift that with album of egg, and place the confection of it not thick nor subtle; and then use of that.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another way to plaster a fracture, dislocation, and sprain: Take asafoetida, lapdanum, acacia, enula, and migrach, which is the root of wild millet, of all ana drac. x; of myrrh and aloes ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; all be ground and sifted and mixed with alichil water or album of hen if the patient's complexion is pale; and then use this plaster, because it is of good composition and restores broken bones lightly, and confers on many men.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another way to plaster which comforts a fracture and sprain: Take migrach and powdered white althea ana drac. x; of myrrh and aloes ana drac v; of acacia drac. vi; of Armenian bol drac. .xx.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All should be triturated in a mortar with much contrition, and sifted, and be conficed with water or egg album and be administered.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.
